Closed for renovation. This is one of the must-see temples in Bangkok but I was frustrated enough that it's closed for renovation to prepare the temple for the peak season on December. Why close the entire temple? What about tourists for the months prior to December? Argghh

Small Temple big architecture. We visited this temple and only had 20 mins to look around because our longtail boat driver wasnt willing to wait any longer.This temple was very busy and the steps were the steepest ive ever climbed, theyre fine going up but coming down could and would be difficult for older people or those with reduced mobility.overall it has to be seen to tick off the list.

Iconic temple, great view on top. One of the most iconic places to visit in Bangkok. We visited at noon, visitors must wear appropriate clothing, my wife had to rent a skirt but its better to bring yours.You must go to the top - amazing view -, stairs are a bit slippery so wear trekking shoes or similar.

Disappointed as temple was closed for renovation. I visited this temple during the evening time and I was greatly disappointed as the temple is closed for 6 months for renovation work. Still this temple management charges visiting fees for temple. I just had to see the temple exterior and nothing more then that. Please note that this temple will remain closed till October 2015 for renovation work so if you are planning to go than please avoid.

Interesting place to visit Bangkok, is the Temple of Dawn.. Wat arun is called the temple of Dawn. Coming here, you can feel the wonderful Thai architectures. You need to cross the river for around 2 baht from the Tha Tien.
Under construction . The entire structure is covered in scaffolding right now. Not worth visiting. You drive right by it on the river boat to Grand Palace/Wat Pho.
Very nice . Went here after visiting grand palace. Worth a visit some of it under construction but still very nice. Steps extremely steep so watch out

Amazing Place to Visit. This place is nice and good looking view. Its all stairs so be careful. But the Architec of this Temple is awesome. You have to pay the Ticket if you like to visit this place for the children is half of the price.By the way you cant smoke here, so you smoke first before you come here.

Underwhelming and under scaffolding. Nice old temple. When i was there. The main temple is under renovation so the pic taken a bit not goodBut the other view was great and it just minutes away from pier by boat
Just nice . This place is beauty, right accros the chaophraya river, which pay 3 baht , but now wat arun still under construction, so be careful
Beautiful. Such history and beauty Thailand is absolutely loaded with hidden corners and beauty! The people are friendly and want to please. I loved the history and atmosphere.

Amazing view!. Wow, this temple was a huge discovery! We were wandering around Bangkok and saw this all of a sudden... if you reach the highest part of the building you get a wonderful view over the river!

Brilliant . Wat Arun has a different kind of beauty compared to the other temples in Bangkok. It is beautiful in its small details on the walls and towers. The painted ceramics give the place a colorful look. Since it sits across the river from the town, it is not crowded with tourists.

Very disappointed.. First time I visited this temple I was amazed by its construction but this time around it was under renovation. Beautiful but scaffolded. Having seen this temple in the past it is really incredible but at the moment it is covered in scaffolding for repairs/restoration so wouldn't necessarily recommend visiting this site right now.

The river view from the hotel made this hotel one of my very favourites. Only passed by this Temple on a river boat. It is a wonderful building to look at. At night dozens of Dinner cruise ships all lit up like Christmas , lovely

Splendid. The temple is located at the river side of the Chao Praya river. All Prang ( towers are decorated with Chinese porcelain. You can ascend some of the Prangs and have a nice view of the temple, river and old city.

Undergoing Renovatio. Be warned, this place is undergoing renovation and so it's very underwhelming at the moment. serene and peaceful. if you want to immerse yourself in silent meditation, this can be one of those locations . It brings in peace to your inner self
Amazing sunrise view. We went when there was scaffolding up for works, but it was still beautiful. Fairly quiet for sunrise (perhaps due to reconstruction) but still absolutely stunning imo

Nice place to take pictures. The temple has plenty spots for taking pictures. Combined with bright, blue sky, you can get lots of beautiful picture here. But currently some parts of the temple is still under restoration, so you cannot climb up to the highest point of the temple

Beautiful Temple of Dawn. We did a boat trip which was amazing and stopped off to see the Temple of Dawn. I do love Thailand, and although this was the hundredth temple we had seen in just a few days we don't tire of it. It was however, extremely hot so take sun cream and water!

Stunning architecture and location. Wat Arun dominates the river vists and is best approached by river ferry (and not the overpriced tourist river bus). great views from the top. Temple of dawn, was interesting to visit at sunset, great views from the top. Lots of smells and sounds. Take the boat from Wat Pho, its just over the river,

Excellent. Very beautiful of thai history. it's worth to see and go to this place. there're many guide there that you can go with them and they will explain all history but of couse you need to pay. weather in thailand is very hot , be prepare for a cover
Favorite temple place in Bangkok. Why it is my favorite? Because of the landscape and the feeling as you made it on all those steep stairs up. Rewarding.
TEMPLE OF DAWN. A visti to the Temple of Dawn was worth it. The construction is unbelievable and beautifully crafted. We really enjoyed our visit.

Climb to the top . As right now there is work on process to renovate the structure it is impossible to climb to the top as I did last year. The experience was like no other.Just sit down and relax before climbing to the top and then when you start to climb start your forgiveness, start to turn on your emotions, give your apologies and do yours. One of the Highlights of my Trip. I loved this trip with a new friend that I met in Thailand. And I will always remember our day there. It was so hot so remember to bring water and something to cover your head and eyes. I've got great pictures.
Awesome place. Can't believe I managed to climb all the way up but it was worth it. The views are amazing. Great place to visit. So beautiful and peaceful.

Disappointing. Obviously they don't tell you that it's under construction before you buy the boat ticket to get there. You can only see metal there. It seems to be a nice temple but just at night when it's illuminated. There are much nicer temples to see during the day

Was under construction. This place athough seemed beautiful was unfortunately under construction. very close to wat pho. (On the other side of river bank) will just cost you 3thb. Do try and visit the road behind the temple. Will make you feel as if you are on some Chinese movie set. :)

Worth visit but touristy.... Amazing how the Temple of the Dawn was built so long ago. It's a little steep going up and down but worth the climb. undergoing renovation at this time.. This temple is visible from the river and was undergoing some renovation and hence we couldn't see it from inside. The sight from the river boats looked very pleasing.

temple for the royal family. it is a temple for the royal family located near to chao praya river, but when i came using the boat the temple was closed for maintenance, but we still can see the temple from the boat.
Under construction ..... This is the WAT of most pics of Bangkok. It's a nice river crossing to get there BUT it's constantly under construction which obscures it's beauty.

Bangkok's pearl. Beautiful temple especially at night with illuminated. A shame to have a scaffold around but high recommended. Also very nice to watch it from the other side of the river or by boat from the river (very good option to see the city from another point of view).

Beautiful place, to bad that they are renovating it at the moment. Beautiful temple complex to see. Unfortunately some parts of it were being renovated, so you can not see everything. The parts of the temple that are not being renovated are still open and look very nice! Worth the visit!
Wat Arun. Temple was under construction, which took away from a large part of the enjoyment, but it's still a sight to be seen. Area is on the river, but isolated from Taxi's

beqautiful, peaceful place. We had this temple complex to ourselves as parts are being renovated and there is some scaffolding up: but the intrictse decorative work, with dancers and statues and floral applique on every surface ae amazing

Magnificent. A wonderful Wat which has it personal magnificence due to its structure and color. I highly recommend getting at least an hour before the twilight, in order to see the Wat with both the sunlight and the illumination from the lights at night.
Great visit, Very much worth the time spent.. Incredible structure, very much worth the trip. Masterpiece of construction. Very clean ground in and around Temple. Very enjoyable time spent there..

A temple of Dawn indeed!. Amazing. How this towering and beautiful temple was built! How it overlooked the expansive river with its majesty! It was being restored so I was unable to climb; however I could visualise going up the steep slope to worship the Almighty.

First class art!. Unfortunately there was scaffolding as they are trying to bring the temple back to its original splendor. However, there is a lot to see and is best to do this one early in the morning.
Must see place in bangkok. Must watch temple in bangkok specially in the night with lights on. it depicts a different acrchitecture.

A nice place to visit !. Wat Arun is one of my favorite temples in Bangkok.These narrow and steep stairs make me so nervous (Going down is worse :D). But once reach to the top, you’ll be rewarded with a magnificent view of Wat Arun, the Chao Phraya River, marveling at the gorgeous view.You can visit Wat Arun daily from 8,30 am to 5.30 pm, The entrance fee for foreigners is 100 baht. Find Tha Tien Pier, from here a small shuttle boat takes you from one side of the river to the other for only 3 baht.

Beautiful, even under scaffolding.. Loved this place. Currently covered in mesh and scaffolding as part of a 3-year renovation. We spoke to the curator and apparently the covers will be off by late November 2015 for anyone planning to travel.

Under construction, but you can come. Used to be the landmark of Thailand (according to my tour guide). I went there at night with night bike ride tour, but it was under construction, so we couldn't get inside the temple and take a closer look.

Mesmerizing. The location is fairly easy to locate. Because the temple grounds are heavily travelled, you can find acceptable refreshments around the area.The history of this location is particularly riveting so I would recommend to have a local friend (if you have one) go with you to explain the deep history and meaning of the wat, its construction, and its history/meaning.The place is beautiful and you can advance up it (climb it). Total time to enjoy it thoroughly is probably 45 minutes.

A colorful delight after gold of all buddhas. A really nice spot for picture taking, full of details plus a great workout due to all the stairs. If you have time dig into details in tiles as some of them are breathtaking. Plus the view is great.

Under restoration. The temple is currently undergoing a major restoration, as a result at the time of my visit the temple was obstructed with scaffolding. It might be worthwhile to visit it when the restoration is over.

Disappointed :(. I was really looking forward to visiting the temple its so beautiful! Especially at night, it is currently under renovation and looks terrible from the outside and you obviously cant visit :( oh well

Fantastic temple along the river. Other place is a must to visit once visiting Bangkok old town are.
Just across the river from grand palace.

Temple of Dawn - with a 4 year old. This was a little adventure for us. Steep stairs and a 4 year old egar to run and explore. But worth a fear :)
The view and the filling on the top - breathtaking.
perfect sunset spot. Probably the best place to go in Bangkok to enjoy the sunset, beautiful, Khmer style temple with super-steep stairway almost to the top

Temple of Dawn as the name suggests see for yourself. That was the summer of 2013 to be precise may. One of the best temples to visit around the world. I am not a very religious person however my freind in Bangkok took me around to show the beauty of the city. Mesmerising views from the temple and a inland river near by makes it a perfect spot to spend some time. The entry costs about 5 Baht.

One of the more well known temples in Bangkok. Expected more, and was kind of disappointed. I think it was partly due to the fact that most parts of this temple was under construction. Nonetheless, enjoyed my time there and was left in awe at the beautiful intricate details.
Awesome place. History of kingdom. Bangkok I like you. This is another historic place that I Liked. Easy to access, many vendors and sellers, enjoyed the locals there.

Not Very Fun. This is such a famous Wat, but it is under major construction. You can see it from the nearby river while on the boat taxis. It had scaffoldings and the whole thing is covered in construction, so much so that you can not see it. I would avoid this one until the construction is finished.

very good but , not on of the best among temples. it was being renovated when we visited the place so we couldn't make the most of our time.The best thing about it was the boat trip before, but it's a bit more expensive if you choose to go by boat ,

Climb at your own risk. You will take the boat across the Chao Praya River to get to this beautiful temple, which is a nice experience in itself and gives good photo opps. The climb up is relatively dangerous but does give lovely views. Worth visiting even without doing the climb.

A great place to visit in Bangkok - don't miss it. Was there this past week, much of it is under scaffolding. Sometimes treasures like this have to be protected so I was ok with that. Still it was plenty majestic.It is set right on the river and can be seen of course, from across the river. Inlaid pieces of ceramic tile, iconic statues and carvings, the place was magical. It was much more compact than the other Wats which made seeing it in an hour easy. We drove there, but there are ways to get there fro the river. This is the one place to NOT miss in Bangkok

What an experience. This temple was one of the first things on my to-do list for my second visit. It is absolutely incredible and a must see when visiting. The sheer amount of effort and detail is just astonishing. There was a bit of construction when we were there but still plenty to see and appreciate

Definitely worth a visit. Very interesting. If you are staying on the East side of the river, take a boat across the Chao Praya to Wat Arun. Then settle in for a couple/few hours of exploring. The temple is very interesting and the juxtaposition of the overall esthetic and the materials used caused me to pause and think many times. Very much enjoyed this as a morning excursion before it got too hot.

Temple of Dawn. We were on an organised tour so arrived by boat which is a great way to travel. We climbed part of the way up towards the top of the temple up some very steep steps but as previously mentioned by other reviewers it is undergoing major renovations so you cannot get to the top currently. Having said that we still enjoyed looking around this amazing and beautiful temple with its great views over Bangkok.

A must to see. This is something to see, amazing temple. However, it is under renovation at the moment so there is a lot of scaffolding around it and you could only get up to the first level. But catch a long tail boat along the river and make sure you stop at the Wat Arun.
A lot of steps.... Another beautiful Wat in the heart of Bangkok City, easy to find but a lot of steps to climb to get near the top ...

Under renovation. This temple appears stunning, but it is difficult to tell underneath the scaffolding. We had been warned about the renovations and accepted this as a necessity to preserve the temple, however, we hadn't realised the extent of the work. To our disappointment almost the entire temple is obscured! The water taxi is 3 baht to get to the temple, and is an interesting ride.

An iconic part of Thailand.. Located right on the Chao Pharya river, Wat Arun is impossible to miss. It is the iconic photo of Bangkok and deserves a good part of a day. Explore it during the day to get a look at the detail close up of the Temple. Lit up at night, it is a magnificent sight.
Good place to visit..... Wat Arun was visited by me alone on my last day in Bangkok as I wanted my journey to end in peace and soberness.... Godd place can be visited.....

Dawn Temple - Worth The Climb. While the grounds are lovely, the real show is from above. The steps to the top (as high as you're allowed to go anyway) are very steep, but it's worth the climb to see the view of Bangkok across the Chao Praya.

one of the must visit temples in Bangkok.. The interesting is you need to cross the Chao Praya river by boat. This temple is not too crowded, you may also climbed up one of the highest temple in this area, the steps are very steeps but the scenery is beautiful.
at night by the boat. Excellent view at night by the floating along the Chao Phaya river. The boat trips are available daily.

An iconic temple well worth the visit. Wat Arun is the logo of the Tourism Authority of Thailand and can be compared to the Merlion of Singapore. Bit like climbing the Great Wall of China on a miniature scale because the stairs are steep but the views of Bangkok are stunning once you get near the top. The temple is on the west bank of the Chao Phraya river so better to approach by boat.

Construction. Just a heads-up: As of August 2015, Wat Arun is under construction. Our tour guide said this will last throughout 2015. They still light it up at night but the scaffolding takes away the charm.

Beware of the pigeons. Quite a nice temple. It is still under renovation so most of the exterior are surrounded by scaffolding. Just be careful when you put your shoes on the shoe rack outside the temple as my slippers have pigeon's poop.

Amazing architecture. This temple is an amazing place to visit. The colours the people who built these structures put into it is stunning.We visited the temple very early one morning before the hordes of tourists arrived. Not just for that reason, we wanted to see the temple at sunrise (given it's name is Temple of Dawn). It really was worth the early rise. It was so peaceful walking around the temple grounds at this time. It did mean that we couldn't actually go inside but this didn't take anything away from the experience. We had to trek through the market whilst all the stalls were setting up which was an experience in itself. It felt like the real Thailand. I think we were actually the only non Thai people around at that time.Thouroughly enjoyed it.
One of the must see temples in Bangkok.. The boat trip over to the temple was an adventure in itself. The temple is currently being renovated, but still worth a visit.

Perfect. Excellent place . Magistic feeling. Very big high rise wat ( temple) on the other side of chao phria river Bangkok. Not too much tourist flock to this side of the city.the temple overlook the river . You can go up hundreds of steps up to get a better view of the temple layout. Climb not easy for older people. You must buy cheap ticket to go there.

Recommended. Came here with a couple of friends in August 2014, Beautiful ancient temple worth the visit. The climb to the top is quite steep and holding the hand rails is recommended.The view from the top (well, as high as you are allowed to go) is well worth getting over any fear of heights you may have. A little dissapointing that tourists have been tagging their names on the temple itself, however a tarp has been erected for tourists to write on to avoid damage to the temple building itself.Definitiely worth adding to your to see list!

Closed for renovations. This temple is being renovated at present so you cannot go inside, only walk around the outside and admire all the coloured tiles, and all the work being carried out by the repairers.
Breathtaking. Breathtaking. One of the highlights, although parts were being restored and inaccessible. Try to climb up the steep steps for some great photos.
Ell worth a visit. Amazing place, there was a real feeling of calm and tranquility even though there were lots of people around.

Stunning, wish i saw it at night!. The only reason i cant give this the full 5 is because i missed my chance to view it at night when it glows like a divine lantern. still out of this world architecture which MUST be seen if you are in the area

a very pleasant experience. I took the boat to Wat Arun, got there around 10AM and it was very empty, wonderful. Loved walking around the property, climbing the steep steps for a special view of the river. Despite some construction/maintenance, it did not bother me. From there I took the boat to see the Reclining Buddha which is on a big property. The boat connection worked out perfectly. I ended up at the other place around noon and it was perfect timing because the huge groups started to leave. What I am saying her is , go and see this place Wat Arun first and then the other big tourist attraction.

Come at sundown . Best time for me to visit this place is at sundown when you come can cross the river and see the temple with and without lights on. River crossing is dirt cheap... Word of advice...the temple is undergoing a major restoration (august 2015) but you can still visit it...
Wonderful spire. The most photographed wat/temple in Bangkok, its spire reaches 170 metres and us covered in porcelain and coloured glass at the top. Good for foties.

An amazing Wat to visit in Bangkok. This is another famous temple in Bangkok not to be missed. There is a main high stupa called prang surrounded by smaller one. The name Arun is derived from the Hindu god Aruna. It seems the complex is build upon an original smaller buddhist temple. You can see it from the Chap Phraya, the main river running through Bangkok. At night it is beautifully illuminated.

Beautiful spot. We walked along the river and took many photos at his temple before taking a boat trip on Chao Praya river. This part of Bangkok is very picturesque. I think this is one of the best attractions of Bangkok.

Peace full End of river ride.. Peaceful Evening in bangkok. This is end destination for river tour. It has different beauty in sun light and moon night. Lucky to witness both. China town market is opposite to this place.

Under maintenance. We couldn't see much works are going on, big part of the fun in this site is climbing the stairs up which is not an option for now. Still charge you a 50 B. I liked the cafe at the entrance, nice ice coffee on a hot day.

Panoramic views of the Chao Phraya. I have yet to see Wat Arun in its nighttime glory, but my daytime visit to this temple has already been very worthwhile. As of this posting (August 2015), it's currently closed to the public for repairs, but once it reopens, be sure to trek up the temple for some really relaxing views of the Chao Phraya river and the neighboring environs. The wall engravings are also something to be marveled at.

Temple of Dawn. Unfortunately at our time of visisting the site was under repair so we did not see the full beauty of this site therefore the score, however i have seen the pictures and once completed it will look fantastic and well worth the visit.
A wonderful experience. We visited here as part of a boat trip, it's a shame we didn't have more time to walk around as there is so much to see.The place is beautiful and very photographic.

Interesting and important site. I realize this site has great significance to the Thai population because the King presents robes to the monks there each year but was a little sparse on scenery for mine as the is limited access so was little disappointed with this aspect but the site is worth a visit in conjunction with other near sites.
Looks good. The temple is currently undergoing repair and restoration work. Did not manage to get in but on the whole it looks good.
Disappointed. I was not able to enjoy the view of Wat Arun because it is currently being renovated/preventive maintenance.

Amazing Sunset View!. They are currently doing some renovation until (November 2015), but the place is still worth the visit. The entrance fee to this temple is just THB50 and to get here, you can ride the taxi or take the boat from the Chao Phraya pier after visiting Wat Pho.

Khmer style Tower temple. Opposite Wat Pho from the Tha Tien Peir no 8. Take river crossing boat to cross the river. This Temple is decorated with tiny sea hells ad porcelain pieces. Lots of steep steps but incredible view of Bangkok
well worth a trip. We visited with Tong tours, so our guide could explain the history, customs and beliefs.You can't not visit this temple as it offers incredible history and craftsmanship.

Work in progress. What can I say? will surely be nice once they'll complete the renovations. At today, unfortunately, it is only partially open and unfortunately completely covered by scaffolding. At least , if the ticket had been reduced or free I could gave it 3 stars, but ... In this way they give me the idea of ​​just grabbing a few baht more from us farang.

Under renovation. I was disappointed to get there and see that it was under renovation.. and they were still charging people to go in. I'm sure when it's not under renovation it is a great place to visit, but I can't say much from my visit. There was a golden Buddha statue holding a bowl and you had to make a wish + throw a coin until you got it in.There is a ferry boat that you can take (forgot the price, but really cheap.. I think 4 baht) to go to that side of the river (look up from which pier the ferry leaves.. I forgot).

Amazingly Beautiful. This temple has amazing architecture and is truly one of the most beautiful buildings in all of Bangkok. It is located along the Chao Phraya River. Everyone who visits Bangkok should see Wat Arun.
Under renovation. Unfortunately the complex was under renovation when we visited and therefore difficult to appreciate. Several areas covered in scaffolding so not a lot to see.
Just another temple.. Its really just another temple of the 786987698 you will see in Bangkok. Its completely covered with scaffolding as of 8/6/15.

NIce Temple & Nice Shopping. Wat Arun temple just finish renovate. To reach here we should take a small boat on chao praya river. Soon as we arrive usually we can do group Photo or Personal Photo and when we want to come back to the boat, they will make it ready to sell on a Plate, or on a Piece of paper. We can find the Thai Coconut, we can rent the cloth so we can look like Thai and we can take picture of us. Soon we can enjoy the beautiful view of the temple, after that we can find some seller sell cloth, souvenir, magnet, etc. Here we can enjoy the scenery, the temple, the chao praya river and the shopping.

Construction on nearly everything.... It was really really sad to see such a beautiful temple covered in scaffolding, especially when it was one of the last things we had to see and had to make an extra long trip. We had this issue with the Trevi Fountain in Rome last year where the reviews didn't explain how disappointing it was. If you're nearby, come look around. It's very close to Wat Pho though a bit of a journey to get to. The tickets are 50 not 100 baht now, but you can't go up many steps at all to the top. The main temple is absolutely covered in dust and rock and metal coverings. While the inside is untouched by the repairs, it's the same as every other wat so not necessarily worth it.

Under Construction. Please note, it's under construction so it's not the best time to visit. Also, it's ok. I think there much nicer Temples to see. If you are around Wat Pho, there is a boat very close that takes you directly across the river to Wat Arun. It costs only 3 Baht.

Stylish Temple. Traveling across the river to the Temple of Dawn, you get a feeling of the size of the temple and its surrounds and if we'd of been able to climb to the viewing platform even better. But alas, the main temple is under repair and unable to be climbed so a big part of the experience was lost.Next visit, if open, we'll head across and have a view from the high platform and enjoy the surrounds.
Amazing. An incredible experience.. A must when in Bangkok.. Just visit and you'll know how beautiful this place is.
Very interesting temple. This temple is worth a visit, however it is being restored at the moment. Its still worth visiting though, and watching the workers restoring it is really interesting.

Nice Architecture. This is the must when you visit Bangkok. You can climb up the temple by using the stairs which are very steep. from the observation deck on the temple(don't know what to call it), you can see the scenery of Bangkok and Chaophraya river. By getting here you can take a ferry from the quay near Grand Palace. So after visiting grand palace, don't forget to come here.

Temple worth it but currently under repair. If you are visiting in the near future just be aware that it is under going some kind of maintenance and is all covered up with scaffolding. I'm sure it would've been good but at moment there's no access and it looks nothing like the gold pictures at night.

My favorite Wat ( Temple) in Bangkok. By far the the best Wat in Bangkok. Stay for sunset and see the image of the temple against the suns rays is beautiful. Its easy to get and one can find peace and tranquility there.Beware of the vendors as their prices are much higher for everything.

A striking site!. Undergoing essential renovation but still a striking site to visit. If steady on your feet and good with heights you can climb up for amazing views of the river and the city. Well worth 50 baht!Unfortunately my visit was part of a tuk tuk / river tour scam which left me with very little time at the site. I would suggest Make your way to a river pier and catch the river express boat for 15 baht. (Central pier is accessible via BTS). This way you get a relaxed visit in your own time and plenty else accessible via the river boat.

Beautiful, especially at night. A unique and beautiful temple. Just to manage people's expectations it is covered largely in scaffolding at the moment as they carry out repairs. Lit up at night it is especially beautiful seen from the river. So take a local boat for a cheap evening view!

Under construction. Wat Arun is in a prime location across the river, however current construction mars the views of this mighty temple. I would recommend visitors check for renovation completion before visiting. It will be wonderful when completed!
Great! . Great escape from this awfull city and wander through old timesTake a taxi or go by train. Take 2 to 3 hours

Spectacular Riverfront View. The architecture of this wat is intricate and beautiful. You don't need to spend a lot of time here, but I'd suggest making the steep climb to the top (if you're not afraid of heights) for spectacular views of the Chao Phraya river and Bangkok riverside. The cost is 50 baht, which isn't bad for BKK. Make sure to cover your knees and shoulders, but should you forget they have sarongs for rent.

Gorgeous temple, amazing view. Gorgeous in the morning with beautify mosaic. Sadly (for us, not the temple) some restoration work was ongoing and we couldn't access one side but the climb up to the top was worth the effort, I highly recommend you try.

Awesome temple in Bangkok!!. It is one of the most beautiful and awesome temple in Bangkok, you definitely don't want to miss it. However, it is still under renovation. From there, you can also go to Asiatique with the local ferry in a very low price.

beautiful temple. this is one of the most beautiful temples i have ever seen although under construction atm still great to see all the intricate mosiacs and beauty
recommend

Under construction. The temple is currently under construction and thus covered in scaffolding (you can already see this from across the river) - hardly worth a visit when there are plenty of temples in Bangkok that are perfectly accessible.
great experience. under renovation , sadly, to get here better use boat,its abit wavey but cheapest,kinda less crowded,easy to storm around

One of the most beautiful temples in Bangkok!. It is a colorful, artistically decorated temple with astounding colors and figurines. It is large, you can walk around and enjoy different buildings and the evening atmosphere with the sun setting in a red sky is truly uplifting!

Most Beautiful Wat in Bangkok. A bit difficult to reach by boat and currently undergoing extensive renovation, this location is less crowded and more tranquil than most in the center of the city. It's a great place to relax and reflect.

Yes indeed its Temple of Dawn. i would say the time we visited was wrong because this place was under renovation and was covered in scaffoldings. Couldn’t enjoy this ancient place well. But I would say I liked the look of that place. The old sculpture and monuments. It also has a small Budha temple besides it. It was still nice to walk around and get a feel of the temple.

Under scaffold. This is one of the temples we had planned to visit as it symbolises Bangkok. We had planned to visit today but we were on the night Crusie last night and discovered it was not lit up but covered in scaffold as it is being restored. It is impresive still the same, However the reps don't tell you that so check before booking a trip, to see it ......

Worth the trip across. This is worth a visit even with the scaffolding. The boat ride is super easy to get on and off (I was worried it be hard) and it's the only dock across the river and it takes you right across with at most a 5 minute wait. Unlike many of the other temples, you can get really close to the temple and walk up the stairs and see the details closely. We came on our 4th day and having gone there, it was a highlight because you could examine the details so closely. It was also not crowded and surrounded by a nice garden. There was food or drinks nearby so plan on coming and going.
Wat Arun. Beautiful again, as are all the temples we've seen in Thailand. But you have to see it, too! It will not disappoint you!
Visit at Dawn. A very tall Wat (there are lights on top of it so planes don't hit it), the're are some photo opportunities here
Shame about the scaffold. We arried after a long taxi drive to find it covered in scaffold. Im sure without scaffold it would be amazing!
Temple along the Canal. This time round it was being renovated , visited in 2012 and climbed all the stairs, very interesting buildin.

Couldn't visit but magnificent at night. I couldn't visit the place but had the chance to look at it while I was in a cruise (Chayo Praya river) at night. It was a magnificent scene to see Wat Arun coloured and lighted with blazing colours.

Under renovations. We were very disappointed as the temple was under renovations and covered in scaffolding. It will only be ready in 2016. It was still nice to walk around and get a feel of the temple.
Amazing view. Excellent temple. The night view is so fabulous that it will make you think twice before you leave this place.

Beautiful temple, but under renovation. As other reviews have mentioned, Wat Arun is currently undergoing extensive renovations. Despite this, we still appreciated the temple greatly and loved the architecture and the grounds. It is actually very nice to see it being renovated, as some parts were very run down. The ceramics are beautiful. We crossed the river by ferry for 3 baht each in the morning. Remember to dress appropriately or a sarong can be rented for 20 baht plus 100 baht deposit that you get back when you return the sarong. Although not as amazing as it would be otherwise, still worth a trip to see.
On top of the world. Wat Arun... as the name signifies.. the temple of dawn...what a glory.. a steep climb if you dare will gift you the most fabulous view
Breathtaking view!. The place looks stunning under lights , daytime can be very humid but worth the visit.Try the Cruise ride for better view during the night time.

One of th emain sites in Bangkok. This temple is one of the most historic and noticeable in Bangkok. You can get a great view from the river, especially at night. I suggest having dinner after dark at one of the restaurants on the other side of the river, which will give you a great view of the temple. I also suggest taking a boat ride on that part of the river. And also take a tour of the temple, of course. It is close to several other sites worth seeing. You really should pay a visit if you are going to spend any time in Bangkok.
Beautiful place but under renovation now. I reached it by boat and about 60% was off access since its having a renovation. Seems beautiful even with the scaffolding all in place.

Currently under renovation. Make sure you check before you go as the temple is currently under extensive renovation. The entire structure is covered in scaffolding and you can't see much. Slightly better at night, but the lights still illuminate the scaffolding so you won't get what you see in the pictures.

Go early or late. Great place to walk around, interesting use of ceramics to decorate the towers. There is a pier near the entrance to Wat Pho, the boat costs 3 baht each way. The restaurant next to the the ticket booth is nice, can't remember the name and has nice views of the river and Wat Arun. Visited again in July 2015, but the towers were being restored, not sure when it will finish.

Temple of Dawn (Wat Arun). Best photos taken at dawn or dusk. Otherwise one temple might look like any other temple.Was there in July 2015 - seems like place is under renovation as there was scaffolding all around.Accessible by boat from Saphan Taksin pier.
Night view beauty. This temple is a must see from the Chao Phraya river cruise in the evening. The sheer grandeur of the structure will leave you in awe.

Awe inspiring. We went here briefly as a part of our long-tail canal tour and were amazed by how much was going on. We couldn't visit much but what we saw was pretty unreal. Plan to spend quite a bit of time here wandering and exploring the incredible detail.

UNDER RENOVATION!. Please note that this attraction is currently covered in scaffolding (see photo) and is likely to be so until November 2015. Therefore, I would not recommend wasting your time visiting! I imagine, however, that it's pretty impressive when it's not under reconstruction.

Must see in Bangkok. This temple is very uniqe and beautiful on Chao Phraya riverside. This temple typically very high. You can climb on top of the temple to see Bangkok city. Inside the temple area you can take a picture with Thai traditional costume with temple background, really nice...
Get there early!. Loved this temple but we were one of the first people there so no crowds around. This would be my favourite temple - smaller and certainly more peaceful than the others.

A Favorite.. It is a must see in Bangkok. The stone structure is impressive. You can climb part up and then you have a beautiful view over the river and the palace on the other side of the river. I just love this temple. Obviously it is best to visit it early in the morning. It is accessible by ferry from the palace side.

Fantastic Views. Arrived here by boat so had lovely view of the temple from the river. We climbed to the top up some very narrow, steep steps which was a bit scary but well worth it when you get to the top to see the amazing view over Bangkok. It was extremely hot so I would recommend taking water up with you.
Under construction, still beautiful. Yes, it's under construction, but I still enjoyed the buildings and thought it was fun crossing the river.

Under works!. Unfortunately almost the whole complex is under scaffoldings right now, and you can walk around half of it, not even go up the stairs... which makes the experience just average or in my case, not enjoyable at all. Not to mention the area where it is located has nothing to see...

" Confused Thailand in India? or Other way around! ". The temple is Indian inspired both in structure and architectural design. The place is solemn and quiet. Thailandized as they say due to the presence of Buddhist monks.

Didn't go in.... It looks amazing from the river as we passed it on a river trip. However it is having work done at the moment and is covered in scaffolding and I am sure this may detract from how it would normally be.

Interesting Temple. I enjoyed seeing this smaller but amazing temple. its close to the grand palace and you take a boat over for 3 baht to just cross the river and it costs 50 baht to enter. It was construction but worth it for me.

Construction :(. It's located by the river and definitely breath taking ! However I could not %100 enjoy due to construction / restoration work.. There was a huge scaffolding around it
I don't know how long will it take but they didn't charger entrance fee
They ask 5 bahts as donation for using bathrooms which are clean...
RENOVATION. It sad when the renovation is on during my visiting period. It quite disappointed. But will rearrange a trip to visit soon=)

An unusual stunning temple. One of the most beautiful temples and so different from so many others. Located next to the waterfront so is easy to get to by boat. Like all of Bangkok, there are just so many attractions to spend time walking around that one visit alone is not enough to take it all in. I spent four days in the city and will return.

Covered in Scaffolding. This is a lovely temple, but beware that it is currently completely covered in scaffolding. It really ruins that glow that you get at dawn and sunset. Normally it is a lovely temple.
Under constructions . I completely understand that theseMonuments need to be restore, but when I went they were under heavy scaffolding which took away from the experience.
A beautiful temple. It was a lovely temple but as it was under maintenance and renovation we could not enjoy much so we cut short our visit
Cool visit. Nice place but nothing much to spend time. Mostly for prayers for Buddhist. Boat ride to wat Arun is fantastic.

Visited while there was site maintenance. I'm sure it would have been beautiful like how I see it in photos. It just so happened that they were doing some sort of maintenance during our visit so I couldn't really appreciate its beauty.

Nice at sunset. I visited Wat Arun at sunset and climbed the stairs to the top and the view was beautiful. Some parts were being renovated and the rest looked very ancient, which I liked. The stairs to the top are very high and some are crooked, so do not go up if you have fear of hights. The whole area around the Wat Arun is very nice and you can reach the Wat Pho (Temple of the Reclining Buddha) with a ferry, which costs only a couple of baht (which is very cheap!).

Scaffolding . Under a scaffold when we visited. Incredibly they were still charging an entrance fee! I think Could see enough from outside. A shame, because I was really looking forward to it. If going from downtown Bangkok, you have to get a boat across the river - which was cheap and quick.

under renovation. under renovation...so...not worth to visit (especially on hot season as we did:((Better to see it via a dinner cruise (illuminated) on Chao Praya River (see my Apsara Dinner comment)

Being renovated, but still great. Extremely beautiful area. Unfortunately the temple is undergoing renovation, but it was still well worth a visit. Grab a boat from the other side of the river and get the whole experience.

Temple seems to be closed/under renovation. While we were charged 50 Baht per person as entry fee, the temple beyond the first flight of stairs was under renovation. We were disappointed because the person at the ticket-counter did not inform us that the temple inside would be closed before charging us the ticket price.

Scaffolding on the main tower. I went on a previous trip. Just leaving this comment here because I noticed the main tower is covered by scaffolding for renovation. So if you're planning on going, you should know this ahead of time!

Under renovation. Still under renovation. Entry fee of B50 for perimeter and level 1 access only. Can easily take pictures from outside (though with scaffolding all around). Looked pretty in the night from the dinner cruise ship
ok ok. honestly i didn't enjoyed much but all my family members enjoyed this place. so if you want to visit the temple i guess its a personal choice.

Worth seeing at least. I saw it from the boat on the river but didn't visit as covered in scaffolding so the construction spoilt it a bit. Can reach it by taking a boat across the river from the main part of the city.
Covered in scaffold. We went to see Wat Arun mid July 2015- couldn't see it as entirely covered in scaffold!!!!wasted journey

History and Great Views. We travelled to this site as part of the tour that I was on and the many buildings and temples were in like new condition. It was a real pleasure to be greeted a senior monk who gave us an unique history of the temple and its sight we were totally pleased with the experience and the history it is a must see in Bangkok

The main Prang is closed for restoration. Unfortunately this beautiful Temple’s main Prang is closed for restoration since 11th February 2015, but it is still nice to pay a visit in the evening.Other useful tips: - Sunscreen is essential as you will almost certainly get burned without it- Drinking Water is essential on a hot day; as there is No Air Condition.- Bring your camera and probably another battery as you will take plenty of pictures!
quick sightseeing. they were doing construction works all around the temple so unfortunately it was not possible to walk up the stairs. it was a quick visit. dont forget to take appropriate clothes

Amazing views from the top. It is mandatory to cross the river to reach the Wat Arun and admire up close the shells and pieces of porcelain that were used to decorate the walls. You must make the effort to climb to the top of the tower, to have the opportunity to see the rich details that clutter and to get magnificent views of the Chao Phraya River and the city.

Lit up at night so pretty even with scaffoldig. Despite this currently being renovated so structure in this picture being surrounded in scaffolding there is still plenty to appreciate. 3 baht on the ferry across the river gets you there, and then you choose whether to pay the 100 baht to get inside. I loved it. So beautiful

Sadly covered in scaffolding. We had been here before and loved it so it was a bit disappointing that the main part was covered in scaffolding but that cant be helped. Try to visit when you are able to climb up some very steep steps as the view is excellent.
Very interesting temple to visit, its different. you really need to go there by boat from Saphan Taksin. Its beautiful, covered in millions of pieces of broken ceramics

Great for photos. A very interesting experience. The effect of the broken pieces of porcelain that are used here is amazing as the sun catches it at different angles. Spent a few hours wandering around the grounds taking photos.
Work was going on!. Work was going on when we visited, hence didn't go inside.. From outside it looked good. Wish we could go again. Anyways the boat ride was fun.

Under renovation!! . They charge you 50 thb to enter and there is nothing to see! As it is currently being renovated you can only walk around it. They should close it until the renovation is finished!
One of the temple along the river. I always access this place by boat. Its a great temple to see at day time and also night time (Light is on) while you're on the cruise having drink or dinner.
bad. When we went to the Temple of Dawn (Wat Arun) there were scaffolds all over the temple so you couldnt really see it

Wow!. Can't believe the intricate work on this temple. Currently under Maintainance but still able to have a good look. No,inside to see, just beautiful ceramic work on the building. Lots of steep steps.
Good to see at night. It's great to see in the evening because of the lighting. However it is under maintenance construction till 2016 so your experience will not be fully complete.

Under Construction. Pretty temple but under Construction. Several of the spheres are covered with scaffolding and can not be seen. Also, women can not go into the main temple unless arms are covered by clothing. You can rent a shawl outside the door for 100 baht, but with the construction and heat it didn't seem worth it. Several of the smaller temples could be entered without covering up. The site was more quiet than the one on the eastside of the river and a water taxi, directly north of the site, can take you to the east shore to see the reclining buddha and palace. The water taxi cost 3 baht.

Disappointing because it was closed for construction . We visited Wat Arun solely to see the Temple of Dawn however it was closed for construction and we couldn't go up. A but disappointed. Not too sure when will the construction be over but check first before going to avoid disappointment.

Under renovation. Wat Arun located on the chao praya side. Pretty easy to reach there either by long tail boat from pier or crossing boat from wat pho. Unfortunately the renovation is still going so its not really worth to visit. I saw some people hire traditional costume to take pics there but i dont think it is good as the background wont be good.

Visit at night until renovation is complete. I love this temple! The Buddha is in a sitting position and also massive (though not as big as the reclining Buddha at Wat Pho). I visited the temple on July 15, 2015 and renovation is still ongoing. The scaffolding is an eye sore and looks ugly on pictures. At nighttime, the temple looks so much better with lighting and at a distance, it is picturesque.
Construction sight, so no visit. Wanted to visit this beautiful riverside place, but due to construction works it was not advisable to visit.

Serene and peaceful beauty!. Unfortunately for me, the temple was undergoing renovation and hence could not go to sanctum Sanctorum.Beautiful architecture. Although of Buddhist, could see a lot of Hindu sculptures and its shadoow on the architecture itself.Very impressive and massive structure. Felt nice to be in this place of worship. Could see a lot of boats in the river next where even tourist boats were seen. A moderate entry fee of 50THB is charged. What impressed me moe was the advise everywhere not to use the revered Budha as a show piece by buying and displaying his statues. There are also small shops where curios and some ready made dress like T shirts, girls tops etc can be purchased. It is a must-see place for any visitor to Bangkok.Rtn.J.Ganesh

Beautiful. To get to this place, you can either ride the ferry or pass a bridge with your car. This place is super pretty. The bad thing is that some parts of this temple is under renovation. Anyway, this place is still amazing.
Currently under construction. July 2015 under construction! You cannot climb the stairs at the moment and that will last for while.

The Real Stairway to Heaven. You have just left earth on your heavenly journey. All that you will see is like a magical dream. This collection of temples in Bangkok is one of the most impressive. You can't take a bad picture here. There are several buildings each offering a different view of the area. All the gold shines like a beacon day or night. The #1 Place to visit in the City.

January 2015 works going on. this beautifull temple near the river badly needed some repairwork and although it is interesting to see how the work is done, many halls are closed and the whole site looks like a building site

A unique experience but closed for maintenance. This wat is beautiful from across the river or up close, in the sunlight and at night when it's lit up. For thrill seekers - climb the main "spire" of the wat and get a unique view of the city! Unfortunately the main spire stairs and many other spires are closed until Feb 2016 for maintenance and covered in scaffolding so until then it's not worth the entry fee in my opinion - enjoy it's beauty from the river.

Enjoyable experience despite the temple condition that is under maintenance. Easily reachable by boat from Saphan Thaksin. Enjoyable site. However due to the maintenance, could not get good selfies around the temple
Under renovations. We couldn't see much of it because of the renovations that are currently taking place. It was still beautiful but I wish to come back once the renovations are done.
Cultural Details. Spectacular sights and rich cultural influences in all the details of the temple. Expand your horizons!

Highlight of my trip. outside of the city palace, this was the must see for us and it did not disappoint. The buddha's were fantastic, and the hindu history here was extremely entertaining as well. The night scenery is supposed to be beautiful, but don't be scared to plan this during the day as it was gorgeous.
Under renovation. The complex is under renovation and not much to see at this point. However the structure looks really great if it is seen during night time when the color lights are turned on.
Under renovation. The temple is a must see, but better to wait until the refurbishment is completed. Still a nice vista from the river, but save the hassle of the river-crossing for the time being.

Currently covered inn scaffolding. This is a beautifully Cambodian style temple on the banks of the river. Right now however it is being renovated and so is covered in scaffolding. Will be great when finished.

Can't miss it. This temple was the highlight of our cultural experience in Bangkok and is not to missed. Its unique shape is really interesting, and walking around the little neighborhood across the river its located in is a lot of fun and a great way to see a slice of authentic Bangkok. If possible, try and see it at night, truly breathtaking.

Be aware wat arun is in restauration for the coming time. Wat arun is especially beatiful vieuwed from across the river, but is now in restauration
No need to go here the coming time
Stunning. Jaw droppingly beautiful. We came away with a sense of calm and amazement. Please go out of your way to see this, both during the day and at night.

At this moment don't bother. At this point in time the temple is under renovation and surrounded with scaffolding so your not allowed up it for the view ..of course this won't stop the ticket sellers selling you a ticket and not telling you this ..so my advice at present would be not to bother catching the ferry across the river to be ripped off .

A visit to another Temple. It's certainly a worthwhile visit, For those who enjoy a bot of temples as well as history, this one will give you both. You got to take a ferry ride across to get there though..

Under construction!. It was under construction when we went so not as beautiful as we hoped! You need to take the ferry across the river to get there, but if you get the day pass and you have all day it's worth the stop and the extra 2 baht.
Brilliant temple. Wat Arun is one of the main attractions in Bangkok. Unfortunately it was surrounded by scaffoldings during our visit, but the site still offers a great glimpse on Thai architecture.

Perfect views of the river and beyond. Climb to the top...it takes some energy, but well worth it! 360-degree views of Bangkok! The hawkers out front can be kind of annoying, but to enter this sacred place is cool!
Under renovation . Wat Arun is currently under renovation. It is still beautiful however you see a lot of scaffolding around it. We got beautiful photos of it from the river.

Under restoration!. The temple is under restoration and may be will take another 6 months to be properly restored, but it is must visit for the architectures inside the temple. It beautiful. Breathtaking and amazing.

Scaffolding spoiled the apeal. The temple looked amazing from the distance but unfortunately it was covered in scaffolding when we visited which took away the beauty of the temple. Worth a visit if there was no scaffolding though.

Under refurbishment. I didn't actually get to go inside the temple complex itself to see it because you can see it when you take a ferry down the Chao Praya river on the riverside. At the time I went, it was under refurbishment for restoring, so the entire Wat was framed in scaffolding so there wasn't much to see.

Amazing Temples. All the temples (Wats) in Bangkok are beautiful and worth a visit. If you have limited time, be sure to at least visit Wat Pho and the Grand Palace near the river. And go as early in the morning as possible. The crowds get huge and overwhelming by 11am and the heat is killer by noon.
Under construction. How can they charge you to visit this amazing temple whilst under construction. All pictures were turd.
Construction On going?. I don;t know if they are still doing the face-lift, but when we went there there's nothing to photograph about but the trusses that is installed.

See it at Night. I took a boat cruise in the evening as that is the best time to view it form afar. I went back the next day by water taxi and walked up the very steep steps. The view of Bangkok from across the river is great - but there is not much else around there so plan an hour to 90 min. maximum to take the water taxi there and back and to climb to temple steps.
very nice. very nice temple, on the other side of the river (crossing is also interesting), being currently refurbished but still incredible reliefs

Beautiful place beautiful view. If you are into temples, this is a must a in Bangkok. It is a scary climb up the stairs of the central chedi, do not allow fear overtake you the view is completely worth it and the stairs have 100 % safe handles. They just look steep but completely manageable. From up top you get a great view of the river and the other side of it where visited Bangkok lays. I recommend getting there by taxi or tuk tuk.

same taxi problem. The best thing is to arrive here by boat. nice trip can see the temple from far and also has no problem with the local taxi mafia.the boat can be taken for different places, when you come with the sky train take exit Taxin bridge and walk to the river, there are boats going up streams, ask the opperator.It is very nice to see the temple at night.
nice, peaceful place. nice, peaceful place, near a river, but i think if you come here u should stay at night and see the Wat Arun in the light

Temples by the river stunning!. The best way to see the temples is via the Chao Phraya orange tourist boat, all with English speaking guide and leaving from a pier near you every few minutes. http://www.chaophrayaexpressboat.com/en/tourist/

Disappointing as currently being renovated. We were not aware that the wat was undergoing major renovations and was covered in scaffolding so we're very disappointed. Check before you go but they looked like they would be there for a long time.
The is a truly beautiful place. WOW is what comes to mind the feeling of spiritual clam is amazing here and the lights at night time are so beautiful

Under construction. Sadly the Wat Arun temple was under construction. We only saw him from the other river bank. Later on we took the boot from the Kings Palace and then we could ad;ire the temple even better.
Temple of Dawn. Nice Temple which was built by General Thaksin where Chinese and Khmer Culture are blending together.

Towering. While part of this tower was under renovation we did get a sense of it's size and scope. The temples and palaces of Bangkok are over the top in both decoration and color. It's truly a feast for the eyes.

Hope you can climb!. Very cool view. First place we visited that we were allowed to climb up. The steps were VERY steep and scary - more so coming down than going up, but definitely worth it! Looks beautiful lit up at night too.

Nice. It a temple on the bank of river and very nice temple I heard it the temple of sun but thing it's under construction so your picture won't as nice as u see in photo and entrance to go in is 50 bhat which is ok but I like wat pho which is other side of it
Beautiful temple. You can go there through the river, when we went there it was under constraction. but i was really good experience to see such a place .

Wat Arun experience. Beautiful place. First time I went there in 2002, once again, as most of things that I have seen and experienced in Thailand, Wat Arun has left deep imprint in my soul, so I just had to go back recently. Took my boyfriend with me. The best way to get there if you're in central Bangkok is to go to Taksin pier by sky train. At the pier, if you're planning to visit more attractions on both sides of the river, I advice to buy a day boat pass which costs from 150 to 300 baht. Once again, that's if you plan getting on and off many boats that day. If not, once you get on the boat going to Wat Arun, you will only need to pay a very small fee of 30 baht. This particular boat will keep stopping at different stops on the east side of the river. Once you reached Wat Arun, a small boat ferry will take you to the west side of the river where Wat Arun is. The place is amazing, architecture and religious art stunning, almost out of this world. Even though it is not very ancient, it certainly feels very ancient. You can walk around this unbelievable structure, can even climb it as there are stairs, mind you, very steep and high stairs. You can only climb half the structure as stairs end, but that is already high enough to see the surrounding areas, the river, miles and miles of Bangkok. Once again, you can get blessings from Buddhist monks. For cat lovers like myself, there are many temple cats just lying around, or following you and making whole experience more fun. Before going through the gates women will be given shawls to cover shoulders if exposed. A shawl is given, you have to leave 100 baht deposit which you get back after returning your shawl. Hope you all enjoy your experience at Wat Arun as much as I did it twice in my life. Almost forgot to mention souvenir shops there

Dawn, or anytime. The Temple of Dawn is one of my more favorite wats. As it is on the beaten path of major sights to see in Bangkok, you should have very little trouble finding and enjoying the area. However, as with all places, it can get very crowded, which is particularly bad in hot and stale weather.
Currently under Renovation . This temple is currently under Renovation. We can't go up as usual. You need to pay THB50 for entrance ticket per person. It is good to go and enjoy the scenery.
Nice note. Its good place to visit. And its near with grand palace, wat po using boat. So many seller can talk english and indonesia. So, you will be enjoy with that moment.

Wat..........a divine place. Wat Arun is always on my list to visit, particularly on a Saturday morning when I am in Bangkok. The best time (as the name suggests) to visit is at dawn. Except for once, I have never gone inside the Wat or the temple outside. However, the location is such that one doesn't have to go inside the Wat to experience its glory. The imposing structure as your boat approaches the Tha Tien pier is in itself an alluring factor. On Saturday mornings, the building next door to the Wat houses a school for young Thais to learn Buddhist chants. The melodious sounds of the chants will leave you at peace on Saturday mornings.

Another must see BKK sight.. You need to be fit to get to the top of this notable sight along the Chao Phraya river but it's worth it, can be reached easily by ferry, you can buy a hop on hop off ticket to see other attractions along the river.

Under renovation. Really disappointed as I was looking forward to this the most out of all the temples & sights In Bangkok. When we got there after many people trying to rip us off for a boat to Wat Arun (You can get a one way boat for 2 baht down by the river) we walked up to it and you couldn't see it due to scaffolding. Strange time to be doing construction during peak tourist season and annoying. Need to go back when I go to Bangkok again

Under rennovation. Most thai people were telling us that it cost a lot to get over to see the wat Arun temple but it literally cost us about 4 baht for 2 of us when we checked out the price itself and there is no waiting around on the water for ages. It would have been an amazing experience had it not been under rennovation as we couldn't properly see it.

Most impressive temple I have seen in Thailand. . Pros. Beautiful temple. Cheap to see. Intricate detailed. Amazing in size. Cons. Closes eArly. 5pm I think. Under renovations. Have to cross by ferry.
Wonderful temple. Boat will drop you at temple. Definitely worth a visit. Best to visit at night. Wonderful scenery , love it so much !

A must-see in Bangkok. You get to this temple by crossing the Chao Phraya using a small ferry boat from the stop right in front. Take the time to make a few photos while you wait for the ferry, since the best vantage point definitely is on the dock for the ferry.The temple itself is so intricately decorated that you can't suspect it from afar. Take a moment to go all around, climb up, watch people praying and climbing, and enjoy the view for the top. There as been restoration work going on for the last two years at least, so don't expect everything to be pristine and accessible.

Lovely at night.. The best time to visit Wat Arun is at sunset. During the day it's hot and there's not much to see if you're scared of heights and you don't want to climb the structure. There's a refreshment place just outside the structure for some cold drinks. At sunset, when it's all lighted and the wind is cooler, the Wat Arun is a sight to behold.
One of the best sights in Bangkok. Even if youre into to staring at temples or not, this is a recommended one to see when you are in Bangkok.

Under construction.. One of my favourite temples but unfortunately most parts of it are under renovation right now. Still we went there and it was worth it, but big parts you cannot see anymore. It will be even more beautifull once the renovation is finished.
wat arun. one of a must go place in bangkok because of their historical temple, ticket is cheap to go inside and good for taking photo..

Temple of Dawn. Just a ferry across the river takes you the temple. You can walk round the statue and have your picture taken. There are many pots where you can put coins in as a token for the monks. Only 20baht for 80, 25 setang coins. And you can ring the big bell.

Worth an up close look.. This temple is one of the iconic sights of Bangkok standing on the bank of the chao Praya. From a distance you don't realise that it is covered in a sort of broken tile mosaic. You are allowed to climb on the temple if that floats your boat and it's a short hop across the river on a boat if you have been exploring the dates on the other side such as the grand palace or wat pho.
Wat Arun. Impressive at night as well as day time.Do try climb up the extremely steep steps,it gives a wonderful view across the other side of the river.

my favourite temple in Bangkok.. Probably my no.1 favourite temple in Bangkok. A must see tourist attraction in Bangkok. You can have a panoramic view from the temple. The stairs are pretty steep. So be careful. Pretty different from the rest of the temples in Bangkok.

Sadly most of the place was under refurbishment. Wat Arun or Temple of the Dawn was touted to be one of the more magnificent and grand temples in BKK but sadly when we were there most of the place was under refurbishment and behind hoardings and scaffolds.

Very interesting Temple. This temple complex is interesting, and we recommend taking the boat over just for the experience. You will never forget the dock, ride or environment. Happy Travels,ExploreTraveler

Nice climb to top. Took the river boat crossing from near the Kings Palace ( 5 baht) then a short walk to the Temple entrance.Long pants need to be warn ( Girls can hire a wrap around Sarong if you turn up in shorts) Its a steep climb up the various steps to the top of the Temple.Views of the river and surrounding area are great ,

Stairs are steeeeeeeep!. Simply fantastic. Genuine highlight of Bangkok, very nicely lit after dark. It is worth climbing up steep staircase to have nice view of Bangkok and river from the platform. It is annoying, though, that people ignore signs indicating which stairs to use to climb up and which down. So inevitably you meet in the middle and on this staircase, no other chance than one of you making u-turn.

Wat Arun a must see in Bankok. Temple of dawn (Wat Arun) is an amazing place to visit in Bankok, we arrived by boat and this is a place that any tourist to Bankok have to visit. Impresive architecture and great for pictues.
Great views. I was lucky to be here in May on the same day Leicester FC of the English Premier League visited. I was easily mistakenly for a footballer, which I didn't mind.

Good but over rated.. I personally found this temple a little over rated. It looks beautiful in the night time. It is a must view once. You can relax in the lawn and if you are want, you can climb to the top to enjoy the view.I found this not even in the top 5 temples in Thailand. But yes youc an have a view of it in the night.

A place you could not miss in BKK. This is the place which called as the symbom of Bangkok and I believe it deserves. The temple is really elegant and with it's ancient history, it's always seems so charming.

Very beautiful temple. The temple is very beautiful and very pleasant to travel, despite the fact that there now is a restoration. The cost of a ticket to the temple 50 Baht. Plus, as long as you follow the river to the temple you have the opportunity to see the city from the river.

Under construction.. Although a beautiful temple the whole temple was covered in scaffolding and the stairs were blocked to ascend the temple. So you could explore the base of the temple and the grounds. Not being allowed to ascend the temple was a severe disappointment!
Stunning!. Beautiful building, we enjoyed seeing it from the river, it just looks so majestic. You must put this on your to do list
Beautiful temple on river bank. Good temple, worth visiting. We enjoyed taking photos and sitting calmly inside in front of budha satute .......

An amazing temple. One of the best attractions (in terms of temples) in Bangkok. Visit the temple in evening or night to see the full glory. Was undergoing renovation when we visited but was worth the visit. Giving a spectacular view of the Chao Phraya River and other side of what would be old Bangkok. quiet easy to reach via boat. A must visit.
Temples in bangkok. Wat arun is very big and peaceful temple in bangkok.it is surrounded by river alsovery nice structures of temple
Temple under renovation. The temple is under renovation. Very limited access. Most area are cordoned off. Do not go until renovation is completed.
Its good place to visit. Its near with grand palace, wat po using boat. So many seller can talk english and indonesia. So, you will be enjoy with that moment.
Dawn but can be visited anytime of the day. Grand structure; Oh it is so gorgeous. One of the must visit places and the most romantic way to reaching there is by ferry. It is beautiful and grand
Another must see temple in Bangkok. Another must see temple! Go ahead, climb some stairs, the view is worth it! You will need to get a long boat here, plenty around to jump in!
nice place. Very crowded place, dont carry many belongings to this place. Beware of taxi n auto thugs they demand anything, i mean false prices. prefer to book taxi by hotel to be safe.

Extraordinary temple for Buddha in Bangkok. The Temple of Dawn is a stunning view from the river Chao Phraya and on the western riverside up close.
This amazing building was scaffolded for restoration in april 2015 when I was there.
Beware of the steep stairs when climbing up and down again.
Wat Arun (Wat Chaeng) is the temple for Buddha; be respectful please.

Lovely, but under construction. I did arrive here slightly late, and it was 15 minutes for closing. However this meant the lovely assistant let us in without paying which was nice of her.It was under construction/ scaffolding was in place when I went which was a bit of a downer. However, what was available was lovely and magical to see. There were also loads of cute kittens and cats in the garden which was obviously amazing.

Good Temple overlooking the river. The history behind this temple is that, when the Thai king won over the emerald Buddha statue from the Mongols, he landed into Thai during dawn time and hence this temple was named as Temple of dawn. The emerald Buddha statue is now placed in the palace complex. However this is a nice complex. Currently restoration work is in progress in this temple. Enjoy the Thai coconut at this temple
renovation. Unfortunately this is currently getting renovated until Feb. 2016 so can't wholeheartedly recommend at the moment. Looks as though it's amazing when it's open though.
Excelent experience. This is place that should be on your list to visit in Bangkok. From a top of Wat Arun temple you have amazing view of Bangkok.

A beautiful temple. This temple is beautiful and I consider a must see if you are visiting Bangkok. Not suitable for anyone who cannot climb stairs as they are very narrow. The view is worth the climb especially at sunset. It gets very crowded so you need to watch your belongings.

Unique. i crossed the chao praya river to reach this place. Nice view from afar, and even better in close. we can make a lot of memorable photo in this place. love the uniqueness of the statues , there is a statue like "chinese warlord" , a lot budha statue , and another thailand-look statue. if you visit in day time , remember to bring an umbrella because its so hot. dont forget to visit the souvenirs shop in this area because its cheaper than another place, dont forget to bargain.

A lovely temple, small, quiet with a lovely history.. Best approached by boat. I like to take people there as part of a canal boat trip. You can have your long tail boat take you to the dock and pick you up afterwards.This temple complex is smaller than most and therefore easier to navigate. Climbing to the top is a fun activity and offers a lovely view. It is a temple so be sure to dress appropriately (covered shoulders and knees). This temple is much less crowded than the Temple of the Emerald Buddha or Wat Po.

Beautiful view of Bangkok, be prepared for the stairs!. This is a beautiful temple, with a beautiful view of Bangkok. However the stairs to climb the temple are extremely narrow and extremely tall. Each stair was half the width of my foot, and the next step up would be above my knee. Luckily there are ropes to hold on to. But be prepared!Also good to note, this is a temple, and temple dress codes apply. (well to women anyway). Even if I don't agree with such things, I like to be respectful. And in temples in Thailand this means longer pants/skirts and covered shoulders.

A iconic place for photgraphers and architecture and history buff. This is must visit for photographers, a scenic wat arun and seeing panorama of bangkok. If you are scared of steep steps and crowd avoid the place.

Beautiful Views. We went up the stairs and took beautiful pictures right before sun set! The steps are worth it. There are quite steep and a little daunting although it is worth the views. Just be careful!
Must visit place. Excellent place... very crowded. One of the best experiences in Bangkok tours. The boat ride is awesome and the view from the top of the temple is also very beautiful. Do visit.

One of the Most Stunning Temples. One of the Must Visit Places in Bangkok.Secure your cash and valuable documents. But do bring enough cash. Wear dress/skirt with sleeves and below your knees. Don't wear torn jeans and do not wear flip flop.Bring umbrella/hat/sunglasses.Be respectful.Be there before 9a.m before the tourists in big buses storm the place.
Awesome. Gorgeous and complex, worth a close up view with exotic gods and tiles which were ship ballast. It is hot and crowded but worth the crowds. Hire a guide for expedition of process.

Best view during Sunset. The temple is under restoration partially. I went there in the morning, didn't pay to go in as it is under restoration. It always impressed me whenever I pass-by the temple on the boat/cruise. However when I got closer to the temple, it didn't appear to be that impressive anymore. The temple is very old, the colour on the wall is fading. I supposed you could climb up to the temple in those days but since the restoration is under going, they closed the section, so visitor cannot climb up the temple any more. Anyhow, you will still get a very nice view from the river. Not necessary to go into the temple, view it from far is good enough.
Amazing night view. Should see at night or evenings - lights on the outside change clors every one minute - beautiful view.

Historic and gorgeous. We traveled on a partly cloudy morning, via the ferry. It was very magical. The historic features and climbing the stairs was memorable. There was less of a crowd than some of the other Bangkok temples and monuments.

Nice night view. Well, dare to climb up the slanted staircase at Wat Arun to get more.. I went there by taking the boat on the chao phraya river. You can plan a temple visit for one shot, as the grand palace and Wat Pho are nearby. It is highly recommend to visit Wat Pho during evening; then when you back, you will manage to capture the night view of Wat Arun.

Worth the Steps. OMG - apart from the stairs which can be quite steep and daunting.... It really is amazing, being able to look at the detail in the tiles and the monument itself, then look across to the winder region - fantastic.

Must visit temple in Bangkok. Wat Arun is must visit temple in Bangkok. If one is staying near the ferry terminal it is easy to reach by Tourist boat (40 Baht one way). Sathorn Pier (Central pier) is starting point and the boat stops at various piers on the way. Wat Arun is at Pier 8 (where Wat Pho - Reclining Buddha temple is also located). From pier 8, catch local boat to drop to other side of the Chao Phraya river (3 baht per person one way) and you can reach Wat Arun. There is a prayer temple in the campus with big Buddha statue and an area where one can offer oil to the lamps. There is a Ganesha status and navagraha statues in the campus along with a laughing Buddha statues for offering prayers.
