Steep Stairs to the Top. A high structure with steep stairs to go to the top of this temple, bit different than other temples. Climbing up you get a good view of surrounding places.

Nice temple to visit if you like heights!. Lovely temple to visit. There is a climb to the top with steep steps, and i'm not great with heights but its worth the view! We rented a private longtail boat for an hour and they took us here, just be aware that there is a landing charge at some places if you go by longtail although its very very cheap.

Nice but not the best . It's a nice temple to visit but not as impressive as the others! It's really nice to look at it from the other side of the river. Climbing up the temple was fun but the view from it is nothing special. Was nice but not the best.

I was expecting much more. We got here with many expectations that were betrayed as soon as we reached the place.Ok the temple is nice but nothing spectacular: in Bangkok there are much better ones.Right now the temple is under renovation so the first thing you can notice are many scaffoldings.The view is not so as stunning as I was expecting.

Great 360degrees view of Bangkok!. If you want to see the 360degrees view of Bangkok...then you have to go up on an exciting climb. Not for people who are afraid of heights...Stairs are really steep. I myself was scared to descend. I felt like falling down. But it is really refreshing when you are on top and in view of the beauty of Bangkok..
peaceful place. Went on a Tuesday afternoon, about 1400 hrs. It was incredible. Definately some serious skill and hard work put into this attraction. Well worth the trip

Beautiful Wat. We had a bit of an adventure getting there, which we did so by a private boat taxi. The operator only gave us twenty minutes at the site which was insufficient. That was our fault for not vetting the operator very well. Nevertheless, the wat was amazing! One could climb the steps up to the very top (at least as far as I could see), but it was so steep I could only make it to about the second level. I took many pictures of the amazing details of the wat, down to the ceramic "plates" that were embedded into the stone. Don't leave Bangkok without visiting this wat.
A great way to spend a hour or two. Love the view, disliked nothing, the ferry rides across the channel is a nice little experience on its own.
Outstanding views. It is practically a vertical climb to the top of the temple of dawn for an absolutely worthy and stunning view of the city across the river.It rightly is the symbol of Bangkok.

Breathtaking view. 50 Baht (SG$2) to enter and climb the super steep steps up the temple of Wat Arun and it was worthit! The Temple was just beautiful located on the river side & you can see the Grand Palace across the river P.S you need to take the cab if you want to go to the Grand Palace. If you are buying any souvenirs downstairs be sure to be aggressive to bargain! The temple, like any many other temples in Thailand is surrounded by the Monastery ; explore them as well!

Must go. I think that if you go to Bangkok the two temples to visit are Wat Arun and Wat Pho. Wat Arun has masses of, very steep, steps and wonderful views. It is truly a spectacular sight. Apart from the temple itself there is a lovely coffee bar in the very peaceful gardens. In busy, touristy Bangkok it is a haven I needed

A must do attraction. I was so glad I took time to visit this beautiful piece of architecture the temple is unique and worth the time I spend there, I suggest going early on the boats get to Ta Tien pier then get a boat over to the magnificent delights over the water, advise to avoid tours and take a adventure on the boats very simple and cheap . Just be carful of the stairs as they are steep but worth the view !

Absolutely Amazing. This temple is one of the mist visited snd famous temple in bagkok. The emrald buddha which was here has been moved to the grand palace. The stais are very steep and hard to ascend and descend, but the edfort is well rewarded frim the top. You get a beautiful view of the city from up there. Lot of renovarion is going in which is good for the oreservatio of such brautiful monuments for the future grnerations to come. A must visit. Do not miss it at any cost.

Place of Wisdom. i have seen alot of temple ( Wat ) in Thailand, but this one was the greatest , it has been build in a different shape and took alot of art , fine engineering to complete this piece of art.the trip to it was fantastic via the river, i enjoyed it alot.take pics as much as you can dears.

a must see in Bangkok. I was not very impressed by this temple but of course it is a must see in Bangkok. Liked to climb the stairs. Not for people who are afraids of heights. Great view over the surroundings.

Beautiful Temple @ Dawn. I visited this temple around 5pm. At dawn is the Chedi is shine by the setting sun and painted it with gold colour. The stair is very steep, when climbing up the Chedi, but coming down is difficult. Walking along the riverside is nice scenic too. Is undergoing restoration now (Which I think is badly needed)

worth the extra effort. This is close to the Reclining Buddha and The Grand Palace just continue walking toward the river and get the ferry (3 baht) it is well worth the time. The climb up this temple is steep but can easily be handled by most

worth a visit. we took an express boat from the other side of the river - central pier at Siam station - cos us 40 Bhat to N.8. If you get off at N.8 you can also walk around the corner to the grand palace. Ideally go before closing time at grand palace so you can see Wat Arun in daytime as well as after dark for better pictures.Bangkok trip is not complete without an express boat ride in the river, and this is one of the easily accessible attractions right on the river.
Great Place. This was one of visit we can never forget. Going upis easy buy coming down will take lot of efforts. memorable experience of visit to temple
Wow. i have seen pictures of this temple but nothing compares to seeing it with your own eyes!!! The steps are very steed and all uneven so you really have to take care climbing them!!!

Majestic vantage point by the Chaophraya river. I watched sun going down and rise with majestic colors from this place, I watched the monks to,feed the countless carp fish in the riverfront from the pier, and the morning is so calm and peaceful,

Decent place to visit and shop. Nice shops/stands next to it. The temple's views are its strength, but it will take some seriously scary (but really not that unsafe if you're careful) steps to get there! Didn't seem very busy either -- fairly easygoing.

The Golden Dawn . A very popular place to visit with great views looking over the river . 50Baht gets you inside where a VERY steep climb to the top provides stunning views . There was some scaffolding on parts of the temple when we where there . 30Baht one way boat trip if you need to get across the river . Great views and great for photographers.

Amazing!. This temple was a workout, maybe the steepest steps I have ever climbed but well worth it. The views of Bangkok are spectacular. We went during the afternoon. If I ever make a return visit I would do so while the sun was setting.
Nice view. I really like this place, there's beautiful view from the top and if you want you can cross the river and watch sunset view of Wat Arun

Health and Safety definately a problem. This building is impressive from a distance, and even more so when we got there, on the ferry across the river. It is being renovated at the moment and it was interesting to see that this is being done by hand. There are very steep steps to climb up, to be able to take in the view from the top, and see the intricate pieces of porcelain set into the building.Some of the visitors climbing the steps were just downright stupid. Young children two and three year olds being being manhandled, just rather spoilt the visit for us. Im sure that there must be accidents here, but not on our visit thankfully.Well worth taking the ferry and making a visit

Amazing detail. worth a visit and admiration of the details. It has very steep staircases so be extra careful. They are doing restoration and cleaning by now so it will look sparkling clean very soon! well done!

Still worth a visit. This was my second visit to Wat Arun. Its quite novel to transfer across the river on a small ferry.The Wat has not stood the rigors of time very well and is under serious restoration. When it has been finished it will look fantastic. However its still worth a visit to see the wonderful carvings and to climb the main temple which give great views. If you wander out the back of the complex there are small streets with a Klong running through. There is a 50thb entry fee. Enjoy!
MUST GO. Beautiful temple, i got a blessing from a budist mong and it was a unique experience. The temple has so much detail, it´s awsome, historic place.

Stunning, absolutely wonderful!. Such a beautiful temple, and the dirt cheap ride to get there from the other side of the river worth every micro-cent! The detail on this monument is so defined and absolutely amazing, though for an acrophobia it was a nightmare trying to climb back down from the top of Wat Arun. I am so happy I got to see this stunning monument on a sunny day, the light blue sky brought out the blue hinge of the temple's tiles perfectly. Love it!

Worth a visit. one of the best temple in bangkok, took a boat along chaophraya river and reach this destination. A 50B ticket was charge if you wanted to climb up to the pagoda, the view up there is superb ! but look out for the steep staircase ! haha.
Decent view. To be honest it was just another temple, good that you could climb up it and some great views of the city, but nothing spectacular

Incredible views from the top!. Beautiful, climbed to the top. Amazing history!Come at the end of the day when there aren't as many people. If you plan on climbing up make sure you can climb back down - its very steep.
Superb architecture. Great place to start a tour of the Temples in Bangkok. Wat Arun is a beautiful example of Thai architecture. Please do go to the top to get a panaromic view of the River
Wat Arun by the river. We got to see this temple in the night from outside during our dinner cruise. It looked amazing with all the lights and ambiance. It was a lovely sight.
Bangkok must-see. Site visit or view from the other side of the review. Iconic temple of the dawn of Bangkok. A must-visit place when you're in Bangkok, Thailand!
Steps worth going!. Great place, huge steps up, but must go, beautiful view. Beautiful wall design, old chinese plates, broken when shipped, were used there as decor.
Amezing place in Bangkok. one of beautiful temple the tourist place in Bangkok Thailand ,The pagoda decorated with the ceramic cup

Great place but under renovation. One of the great temple in Bangkok. But at the moment under renovation. It will be difficult to get a good view and photographof the temple. No information when the renovation will end.

Great business cum leisure hotel. Its the icon of bangkok and everyone who visits bangkok should definitely pay a visit to the Temple of Dawn. Also the view of the bangkok across the river is a good relief after the treacherous climb to the top!

stunning and a must see while in Bangkok. it is truly a masterpiece..amazing temple complex. unbelieveable architecture, very mystique place if not overcrowded..you can climb to the top but think better twice because the stairs are too steep. So steep that if you were afraid of heights that is definately a big no for you. the view from the top is beautiful, you can see the Grand palace, wat pho complex and enjoy the view over the river of a truly buzzling Bangkok

Peace one gets. One gets peace when you sit and meditate in the temple with Buddha in front of you... What more do you want.... after hectic day at Bangkok market,, some peace and silence is required, one will get here.

An experience. Excellent, lots of steps fabulous view, wonderful canal trip over we had a personal guide form Bangkok tours which we would recommend as you most definitely see more learn more experience more

My favorite temple. This is by far the best temple in Bangkok. You can climb and see a great view of the city. You can take a boat from the dock near the grand palace, that take you from one point of the river to the other for a few cents.

Must Visit Place. This is one of the best place to visit while you are in Bangkok. As I live in Bangkok and this place is just 10 minutes drive from my place. I always wanted to visit this place since I was here, but could visit. It took 2 years :p and finally I went with my wife. We went in the afternoon and it was so hot. Best recommended time is around 4 pm to 5 pm, easily accessible via taxi, and boats. The architecture of this temple will just mesmerize you. You would have never seen something like this before. Be careful while climbing up and coming down the stairs. Just opposite of this temple other side of the rive is: Wat Pho, where we already had gone there, that place is also awesome.

A must see for all tourists to Bangkok. Wat Arun is majestically located on the Banks of the River, with a ferry ride to reach it from the other side.Although one of the sides of the four sided Temple is slanting in a dangerous way, it is quite an experience to climb to the top and see the view of the River and Bangkok city.The ambience is wonderful at the adjoining Park and rest area.Hope you also enjy your visit.

A Must See in Bangkok, but Dissappointing. We noted that this was the top thing to do in Bangkok, but was disappointed. It was only 50 baht to get in.The problem was there was extensive works going on. Therefore, there was scafolding, rowdy workmen and so much rubbish everywhere.The detail on the temple was amazing. You can climb the steps to the temple but these are VERY VERY STEEP, and what we did not apperciate, the steepness was the same coming down - I had to walk down backwards.The views from the top were amazing, you could see the roofline of both old and new Bangkok.The temple lights up at night, but we had left by this time.I think if the building works had not been going on, I would have apperciated it more.I do think it is worth doing as it is one of the must sees in Bangkok, and the entry price is cheap.Please also note that females are expected to dress conservatively, covering legs and shoulders. You can buy a cheap pair of trousers for about 150 baht outside the temples.

Live a full experience of climbing a temple to get the view of the ancient city.. Embark on a long tail boat to cross the Chao Praya river and enjoy the view of the temple from the river.Efforts to climb up Wat Arun are more than worth the view and feeling of living fully the bangkok experience. I recommend taking a guide as you will find no sign on the visit. Note that the stairs are very steep. If you are afraid of heights, take it slowly.

A steep climb to the top. You have to take a 5 minute ferry ride from the Grand Palace side of the river to reach Wat Arun. The temple is nice and is worth visiting. There is a very steep staircase that will take you to almost to the top of the temple structure and the view from there is nothing short of amazing. There are long tail boats parked outside the temple that will take you along a canal network if you are interested in seeing old Bangkok.

This temple is so unique and beautiful!. The climb to the top rewards you with amazing views and a nice breeze. The grounds are removed from the hustle and bustle of the city, making it a truly peaceful spot.
Breathtaking. be it morning or evening, you would love it, its just so beautiful, if you are in bangkok and love culture and architecture, then you shouldn't miss it out

The best temple in Bangkok. Wat Arun is for me the best temple to visit when you visit Bangkok . It offers a superb view over the River , the Royal Palace as well as Wat Pho .
Simple and easy to climb to the top .
A must do !
Awesome. I loved everything and disliked nothing. a most visit fort all visitors to Bangkok. To remember forever and to retell to friends and family back home and to recommend to all to visit.

Interesting despite restoration work.. Watching the workmen clamber about the scaffolding was almost as interesting as the temple itself. Climb to the top for some good views, but a close look at the intricate ornamental sculptures.
Extrodinary. It is an amazing structure which is really interesting. The steps are exremley steep and if you do have issues with height then you may struggle to see inside the temple.

My favourite temple in Bangkok. It was nice to visit Wat Arun. It's not really big temple, quiet simple if compared with neighbours's temples but it is charmy and it gives a relax feeling. It also a great view point, specially by the sunset. If you have few days in Bangkok and you would like to visit some temple, i truly recommend Wat Arun.

Impressive. I love the view of the temple, so impressed with the architectural intricate details. It's really worth a visit. Be sure to watch out on your way down, the stairs is so steep. A must in your itinerary.

A Must See. We visited Temple of Dawn via our canal trip and what a spectacular site that greeted us as we made our way up the river. The sun was setting too and the Temple was lit up, spectacular sight to behold in the bustling city of Bangkok.Wasnt as busy as i would have thought but i would put that down to the time of day we went. Climbing the stairs was an experience for my poor legs but once at the top the views are breathtaking.

Amazing Site. Amazing temple worth visiting, entrance fee 50THB. I highly recommend visiting Grand Palace in the morning and later Wat Pho and Wat Arun. You can easily do this by yourself. Walk from sight to sight, and catch the ferry from Wat Pho to Wat Arun for only 3THB/person. Climb to the top is great despite very steep steps. Highly recommended, a must.
Spectacular. One of the more spectacular sights in Bangkok. Must have seen it more than 20 times now but always impresses me.

It has to be seen at least once. Nice climb to the top and catch a glimpse of the river...
We went there around midday and it was busy I'd recommend going later in the afternoon when its cooler.
Wat Arun. to get to this temple, you have to cross chao praya river. sadly i went there when the temple was under construction but still its quite interesting.
Well worth visiting. Like all the temples, this one does not diappoint, you can easily combine this with the many other temples in a single day. A must on the to do list
One of the most beautiful ones. I love this temple. The mozaiek is beautiful and climbing the steep steps is quite an adventure. At night, it's beautiful lightened up.
gave you a glimpse of time gone. More of an old temple, very busy, right by the time river. You can climb up the temple and get good views of Bangkok
Stunning. Beautiful and inspiring. Take your time and enjoy this one. As most well crafted and ornate.in a city of temples maybe one of the best . Enjoy

Some Test of Faith. We visited this place on a burning-hot afternoon.Probably it would be better if we went there by night. Or maybe it was a blessing that we went there by day otherwise it would be a lot scarier to move up on those steps. I really appreaciate visiting this place. However, it may have been more interesting if the Wat was some hundreds of years old. Turns out, the Wat has this feel of being articifical because people were doing some construction in nearby wats when we went there.

Different to the other temples. We took a city tour on a longboat to see this temple. It's great because it's so different in architecture to the other temples in Bangkok, and is so old. The view from on the temple is fantastic, as you can climb up onto it. Just be aware that it's very steep. Taking a night cruise is worth doing to see all the riverside temples lit up at night - beautiful.

It's a test of concentration and willpower.. It is just across Wat Pho and I think it should be THB $ 50 per person. :) All you need to do is just to climb out the steep stairs. Just take it like you are doing lunges and you will be up there at no time.When you are coming down, people tend to go by reverse direction and ask the other tourists on top to take photos for them. Otherwise, just treat it like military obstacle courses and walk down fast the steep stairs. It is less scary and the momentum keeps the going down less exhaustive.

Must Visit in Bangkok. If you have time, Wat Arun is a must-visit place in Bangkok. You will experience the traveling on river, and see the historical landmark of Bangkok. Try to climb to the top if you dare.
Night or Day. You should walk around a get close up views during the day, then go by at night in a boat along the Chao Praya River.

Very steep steps (a little scary). It is a good attraction to go see. My only pro tip for you is always have cotton breathable pants and long sleeve shirt. All of the temples require you to be fully covered up and if you have jeans it can get uncomfortable.

Impressive Temple. The temple is encrusted with colorful porcelain. Climbing the temple was not so bad; however, coming down the stairs was a bit scary. The view from the top was nice but not as impressive as others have mentioned. The ferry stops across from the temple, and you take another ferry to take you across the river. The cost is 6 baht. The entrance fee to the temple costs 50 baht. There is no dress code for visiting.You can visit the Grand Palace, Wat Pho, and Wat Arun all in one day if you start your visit early.
Good day. Very nice place and we had a good time everything was fin and the family had a good day. absolutely great and all good for a good day

A top choice on things to do in BKK.. What more can you say that has not been said in the other 5,000 reviews. But as a resident of Bangkok, I can assure you that this should be one of the things you do on your visit to Bangkok. Wat Arun or The Temple Of Dawn is spectacular in color and design. The grounds are not huge so you will not be overwhelmed with lots of space to cover. Of course this is a Buddhist Temple. The porcelain and glass sparkles and the 2 demons that guard the temple are inspiring. If you attempt to climb the stupa, the central building to the temple, be warned that the stairs are steep and there are no railings or any object to hang on to, so be very careful. The murals and architecture are beautiful. Best way to get to Wat Arun is to take the boat from Saphan Taksin (first take BTS to the Saphan Taksin station). Then go downstairs, and take the local boat. It stops at all the piers. Do not take the tourist boat. It is much more money, unless, of course, you decide to get on and off the boat many times. Go to Tha Tien pier and take the boat across the river to Wat Arun. 2 baht. The temple charges 50 baht to get in but they may be asking for donations throughout the temple. Of course, Wat Arun is best seen from a distance, all lit up, so maybe a river cruise at night will give you great and lasting pictures of this beautiful temple.

Such amazing detail. Took a trip to this temple and enjoyed exploring its nook and cranny's. The detail is truly exquisite. At this temple you have the option of climbing up to almost the very top, which makes for great city view photos. It is important to remember dress code when going. Although shorts were allowed, they needed to be below the knees and no sleeveless shirts. They do have shawls to borrow for a small nominal fee, and I would recommend wearing shoes that are easy to take on and off, as you must remove them when entering certain parts. This temple is across the river from an active food/fruit and flower market, which makes for additional, interesting finds.

Stunning- and scary walk. We stopped over during a boat tour along the river. And it was incredible. We walked all the way to the top after having seen a couple of monks preying at the bottom- and, boy oh boy, it's a sheer drop coming down those stairs. Not for the faint hearted1

Great place for Photographers.... Go early in the morning to catch the magic light and seek out some unusual angles, great views of the river traffic as well. I recommend catching the ferry here to enjoy the river life as well.

great. great architecture, great view from above. less crowded. and the grounds are just as great. we came there during the loi krathong(river) festival. the environment is so festive with lots of food stalls.
Worth your time. I've been to Wat arun a million times and it still amaze me. Take the ferry from Wat Pho. Great to visit late afternoon.
Great Temple along the river. A wonderful temple along the river. Built in khmer style and one of the most impressive temples I visited.

worth a visit. A very calming experience ! Must do when in Bagkok. Use the ferry to get there.
Pretty crowded so go early.

Great view from boat. if you want to see this temple, you can only take a taxi boat foreman of the pier and you will see it. Disembark close to it at one of the station. The ride cost only 30 baths rather than 150-200 that taxi's will charge you.

Awesome architecture. Went here with my brother and girlfriend. Need to take a 2 minute ferry to get there but once your there it's really beautiful. Architecture is amazing and your able to climb the steps close to the top. But it gets pretty Steep so.be carefull. Make sure your arms and legs are covered, but they allow to rent a sarong if you need lol.Must see if your in the area

The Best In Bangkok. This Place Is The Best In Bangkok For Me. For Thai People, The Entrance Fee is Fee. Make Sure You Dress Appropriate While Visiting.No Shorts Or Top Tank Allowed. Climb Up To See The View Of Bangkok Is Worthwhile. The Night Time Even Makes It More Fabulous. inside, You Will See Giants (Green and White) Would HigHLY Recommend. It Is A MUST Visit In Bangkok.
Beautiful Temple. A must visit temple. The architecture is outstanding. Be careful when you visit now because they are some renovations work being done.

Great place,. Wat Arun tample is one of the best attraction place in Bangkok. It is very unique and interesting. IT was not so crowded like Grand palace. The entrance fee only 50 Bath and you have fantastic view to grand palace and to the City. very easy access with boat. it cost 3 Bath from one side of river go to the another.

Beautful and detailed. Very nice temple. See it from a distance during when it is dark to appreciate the divinity of it. During daytime the attention to detail when close-up inside is the best approach. Majestic.
Temple of Dawn - a must!. It attracted me from across the canal (yeah it's not a river) It's just striking to see from afar, and even better when you climb up!
high, tired, but worth it. OMG, I loveeee the architecture so much. you have to climb high till get to the top, and see an incredible view of Bangkok. beautiful!

So much detail!. So glad we got time to visit this Temple... it was amazing!Everything has so much beautiful detail. You need to see it to believe it. You get a nice view of the river from the top as well.Get the ferry across from here for 3 baht to go and see Wat Pho with the reclining Buddha.If you are in Bangkok to see the Temples like we were, don't miss this one.
Beautiful. See during the day to admire details.. Loved it at night too. So magical with light reflection on the river. Steep steps though. Careful going up or down.

A great example of Thai architecture.. Seen from a distance, and especially at night it is spectacular.Get up close during the daytime to really appreciate the effort and skill which was needed to build it.You can climb a couple of levels. But beware, it is very steep and I wouldn't recommend for small children or older persons.You will be rewarded with a good view of the city.There are other temples on the complex well worth visiting.

Stunning. You have to pay to cover your knees, elbows and ankles. Which is ironic because the place was heaving with half naked Russian women when I arrived (must have been a big tour group). The walk to the top is a challenge and there were many people at the bottom who chickened out, but the view from the top is stunning. If you take a river tour to get to the temple, the view of the temple from the river is nearly as impressive as the temple top. Keep your eyes peeled for the entertaining carvings on the 'City centre' side of the top tower, they made me smile.
Beautiful. It was worth seeing! I got some beautiful photos. Plan to spend at least an hour or more in any of the compounds you visit. The detail is incredible!

Wonderful. We did a private canal tour that ended with a tour of the temple. The climb was exciting but a little scary! Maybe don't wear a dress (like I did) unless you want to hold it the entire time so people don't see up your skirt ;) long pants may do better.

Crazy stairs, nice view. Heck of a climb, especially if you're a woman using a sarong to cover your legs, but it's a great view if you make it. Fascinating to look at the pottery bits used for the facade. A one-visit attraction, I wouldn't make the effort if I passed through Bangkok again.

Nice, but not the nicest.. This temple is beautiful, but it is nicer to see it from the other side of the river, than to be in it. Anyway, if you climb the REALLY-steep stairs you can get very good views of the city.

Good Exercise. One of the nicest "Wat" in Bangkok. Maybe because I was there at sundown. Therefore, its nice and windy and cool. The climb up and down is very steep. The taxi ferry is good for 3B to cross the river. After Wat Arun we cross back to the other side and take the NO 8 pier to Asiatique.
Need i say more. Palce to visit for sure when you are in bangkok. Combined with a "ride" on the Chao Praya. A lot of sites to see in the neighborhood

Touristy atraction. This is an example of an attraction you just visit once in your life, take a few pictures, and say you have been there. Skip all the touristy shops at the bottom, get a charm from the monk, and head straight into the temple. The 50 Baht admission lets you climb a steep staircase to that top of the temple. Good views , allows you to take good pictures. Not recommended for the old and faint hearted, the stairs are rather daunting.

Must see in Bangkok!. Incredible ancient temple located in Northwest Bangkok. This is a must see! If you are coming from Sukhumvit or central Bangkok, take a cab to Wat Pho and then the ferry across the river (3 baht per person each way). Taking a cab or a longtail from central Bangkok to Wat Arun will be very expensive. The stairs at Wat Arun are very steep, be cautious coming down!

Amazing temple on Phraya River. As we were riding the Phraya River, we stopped to see this golden temple. It's shape is like a pointed high pyramid. What was exhausting to us is climbing the narrow steps to go up and have a look from high. It was a nice experience.
Very special temple. Exciting ferry to the temple. Very bluffy stairs, but very nice view. Very nice place overall! It is different that the Buddha temples, so it is a must see in Bangkok.

Another Beautiful Temple to visit in BKK. here's one of the must place to visit in BKK. from Wat Pho, you can take shuttle boat acrss Chao Phaya River to visit Wat Arun very easily. the signature of this temple is the sculpture and achitechture was influenced by Chinese age. The designated pagoda was decorated with China bones. you can walk to up to the pagoda to see the nice view on the top. the temple is located just beside the river. there're souvinirs shop nearby if you need something back home.

nice site to visit across from Wat Pho and Royal Palace. A quick ferry across the river and you are at Wat Arun. Take hte time to view the place. Tourists abound but it can be serene. Also nice view of the main city.

Nice temple. The most interesting feature of the Temple of Dawn is the tribute to the former King. Interestingly, his statue actually stands ahead of the large Buddah statue. Climbing up the stairs of the temple is a challenge. Be watchful of pickpocketers here. Also be aware that there is a lot of commercialization inside the temple grounds.
Incredible temple. You reach this temple witha short boat trip ( 2-3 mins), and you are in front of a vertival wonder.You'll be aastonished by the engravings of this temple.

Go there, climb it, enjoy the view.. The climb isn't exactly nice, especially not in the hot April temperatures. In October it was okay but, please, follow the signs that say up or down. Some people always ignore those and the stairs are steep and narrow enough carrying camera and water and all without ignorants clumsily approaching from the opposite side ;)

Beautiful temple. We had to cross Chao Praya River to get to this temple. The fee is about 3 bath per person per trip. There was a place renting Thai Royal clothes close to the entrance to this complex. The fee was about 200 Bath per person. Then you can take as much pictures as you like with your own camera.The main temple itself was very beautiful, but it was very tall and the stairs were too steep for us. We were only reaching the first half of the temple. There were a small marketplace at the back of this temple. Don't forget to haggle if you are buying a lot of item.I recommend to visit this temple in the morning before this place get too crowded with tourists.
nice place for some one looking for this kind of architecture. one of the land mark in bangkok. good for some one planning to cover the land marks. its on the oppo side of river from royal palace.

Historic site. One of the must sees of Bangkok. I was in the city for 2 days and the temple was on my list was a must see on my final day of sight seeing. My guide explained the history and the relationship of the site to the people of the country.
A great view at night. The temple is very beautiful especially at night when the lighting gave it an excellent view especially from a river cruse ride.
Great Views of Bangkok. Here you can take very nice pics of the chao phraya river and of the temple that is also very nice, but climbing to the top is not easy, so come with your sneakers and enjoy.
Great place. At the heart of city and must place to visit, we enjoyed the river ride to reach Wat Arun. Temple was very good and must visit
Beautiful!. Absolutely a must! Very beautiful tempel, the mozaic is wonderful. To climb the stairs to the top, you will have a fantastic view over the river.
Must visit. Climbing the slope stairs is a very special experience, however, not suitable for old people. It is especially beautiful after 6pm.
Must See. If you go to any temple in Bangkok this is the one to see. They are doing some restoration work but it won't take away from the experience.

VISIT TO WAT ARUN (TEMPLE OF DAWN). This Temple sits majestically on the banks of the Chao Phraya River and is well illuminated in the evenings to make it stand out in the Bangkok skyline.The climb up the temple is rather steep and the stairs are narrow. Make sure to wear comfortable shoes.This is one of the oldest temples in the city and worth a visit. It is easily accessible by river ferry boats through the day.

Brilliant place. I was IN HEAVEN!! Wat Arun looks amazing either at the day time and at night!! Amazing place to visit.Must see in BKK!! Lots of turistst, but it's understandable! You can take great pictures from there! If you're affraid of heights...probably it will be your personal challenge :)

Beautiful in day and night. This temple provided a good view of Chao Phraya and the nearby structures. It was beautiful in the daytime whereby the details on the temple walls could be seen. The climb up to the top was worth it though it is steep (do not wear skirts :) nor long flowy sarongs as you may risk tripping when climbing or descending). Also, it was really easy to get there; a quick and cheap boat ride across the river and you would have reached the temple grounds.The temple is even more beautiful when viewed at night, in my opinion.
Beautiful to look at in the night. Beautiful to look at in the night across the river. It's worth a visit during the day too but be warn of hot day!

Go at night. If you walk behind the palace and down a tiny road (almost feels like you shouldn't be there, but it's fine), you can see Wat Arun in lights. The temple looks very impressive standing tall above the river with party boats going by.

Famous and iconic. A must see because of the historic significance. The climb is steep - wear comfortable shoes with good support. The view is cool. Not too much to see so you can do this in a quick stop (1-2 hours).
Fab. use the local ferry boat that goes to all the temples and attractions get a day ticket and you can hop on and off to see all the different sights around Bangkok
Under restoration. The temple is currently being restored so there are large parts of the buildings covered in scaffolding which really spoils the serenity and atmosphere of the place.

No need to climb at pagoda wat arun. No need to climb , so no need to buy ticket to go in , recommended for prayer in right and left side of wat arun , have a monk would blessing you if you donate to sangha

Fabulous views after a steep climb. This isn't for anyone afraid of heights or who struggles with stairs. Actually if you don't like heights I would suggest conquering that fear to experience the fantastic view from the top of the temple. But the stairs to get to the top aren't small - in fact each step was almost knee height for me - and I'm about 5'5". The ferry across from N8 (Orange flag ferry stop) costs just 3 baht each way and is a nice addition to the trip. A nice temple - it doesn't take as long to look around as the grand palace or Wat Pho so if you're short on time you can fit in a trip here without worrying.
Spectacular!. Really interesting... Don't be deceived by the top steps, they are really, really steep! The views across the river from the top are worth the effort, but you need a head for heights.
Awesome. This temple is a "must" in Bangkok and is best reached by boat.. Be warned that there is a steep climb involved.

nice temple. a must if you come to Bangkok for the first time. Just take the ferry from chinatown/ grand palace. Yo ucan climb up but a bit "tricky"
big steps!
Be prepared for a steep climb. I love the views from the top and the traditional stalls below. A must see in Bangkok just be aware the stairs are extremely steep!

Exhausting but thrilled. We travelled to the temple by boat around 2pm.You have to pay an entrance fee to enter the temple and the toilet which are clean. The climb is very steep around 50 degrees? The steps are also very high.However the view at the top was really amazing. Going back down was also a little scary but there is a metal railing for you to support yourself.In my opinion Little children and persons who have physical conditions should not attempt to climb up the temple. They should choose to stay below and take photographs.Overall i think its worth it a once in a life time experience.
Very Steep. We approached this very historical temple, I have to say it was old but worth the view when you got up there, Very pleasant and historical
top attraction in Bangkok. Views were absolutely amazing. Hike was nice when there is not a big crowd. Boat ride across the river was nice and inexpensive.

Great view at night . Worth the view at night when you're opposite the river. We didn't see the inside as we had been to many that day. Had researched that the view was best at night so we went to the park opposite the wat and waited for sunset.

Steep Climb. The steps were quite steep to climb and I had my own doubts if I would really climb down but fortunately it did seem to be easy. Just focus on the steps and try to place your foot sideways to take maximum advantage of the small stone step to climb up and down. The ornamental highly decorated pillar like towers are amazing and getting their reburshing done now. Temple of Dawn is close to the river and a ride on the speed boat is recommended.

Unique. The ferry to get there is already a nice thing to do because we can see the intense activities in the river. The temple is great and the monument is unique. I did not see any similar place in the other countries I've been.
Amazing views. We went here on longtail boat up main river. Only had 30mins to visit and could have spent longer. Lots of steep steps to climb up but views worth it. We will go again when in Bangkok.

Small site but worth the visit because of the climb and view. Small site, the main attraction is the climb up the tower not tall but very steep. Ladies definitely wear flat shoes. Most people going back down on their bums! reminded me of walking up Chitchen Itza in Mexico. Great views up and down the river and of Bangkok city in the distance. Opposite the royal palace the other side of the river so easy to get to and only £2 entry fee.

A different experience. All the Wats located in close vicinity and have unique feel to each of them. There's a blend of ancient times and eye pleasing locales giving a feel serenity in the inside compound. Worth a visit.

Nice though fairly small.. Yes, it looks great lit-up but bear in mind that the temple closes at 6pm!!! We went a little before 6 and were able to take a quick look around, quick climb up the main temple building for pictures, etc. We were then able to take pictures with the site lit-up. Boat crossing is only 3 baht each way!

Good as a platform for Photos over the Chao Phraya. I almost feel bad about giving Wat Arun just 3 stars but when compared to some of the other more ornate temples and opulent palaces it can be shadowed by it's more glamorous neighbours. It's only when you get close to the temple when it's true beauty and range of colours can be appreciated, a steep climb to the viewing platform rewards you with cracking photograph opportunities across the Chao Phraya and city. I wouldn't visit Wat Arun especially but if you're cruising along the river it's well worth an hour of your time.
Certainly a must.. Take a small ferry near the palace. Quiet environment and an early evening visit creates special atmosphere.
Good temple. Staircases are strip and hard to climb. However a good river and city view can be seen from the top.

Temple of Dawn. There are a lot of temples in Bangkok and around Thailand. We found this to be very peaceful and tranquil. The surrounding building are amazing. And the history behind it a long one. Best to get a guide who speaks your language.
Just Lovely. Not to be missed when in Bangkok. This temple is so beautiful and exciting. Awesome landscape, exciting temple climb, and just lots of monks.

A must see in Bangkok. This unique and interesting temple is a must see in Bangkok. Amazing attention to detail and dedication to its construction ions ago! Easy to get to via the public boat transport along the river then a short 3 baht (10 cent) ferry crossing. Cross back across the river to access the reclining Buddha and the Grand Palace. Did all three in about three hours. Great history of Thailand represented.

Worth a visit. Easy to get to via the public ferry on the river (get off at reclining Buddha stop) and then get the cross river ferry to it.Ladies need to cover legs and shoulders but they do lend stuff. Beware that the steps are very steep to get to the top. Whilst you are there, and if you can, you get a great view from the top! Then have to go down the stars slowly backwards!We passed here late at night also and it was beautifully lit up

Wat Arun bangkok. The entrance fee is 500 bath per person.......its bangkok's iconic temple... Loads of tourists of course... opens at 8.30 am til abt 3 pm...Stayed in khanson road, haggle with tuk tak from 100 bath to 40 bath, got back in a cab at 100 bath..too tired from the heat ...Jus bear in mind that tuk Tuks do not enter certain areas like from khason , they do not go toSiam paragon, or city areas as there's a penalty if they are caught.I got a bus back from Siam paragon mall to khason, bus 15 .... Free not sure why as nobody collected any money from me... Anyway get a hat as the heat will get to you ..

Lovely temple with great views. We had a great visit to Wat Arun. The temple (like many) is lovely, but the highlight was climbing the very steep steps and taking in the views of Bangkok. (Beware of people ignoring the signs as to which stairs are for ascending and which are for descending.) It was really easy and cheap to take the ferry from the other side of the river (at Wat Po) over to Wat Arun. It was also easy to plan and board a longtail boat drive from this location, which was a plus.

Unique temple. Steep climb makes this temple very unique. Steps are substantial and steep, but the experience is breathtaking. The short boat ride 3bht tends to be jammed with people. Architecturally impressive and very ornate. No entrance fee
Local Attraction. Building & History you can climb and see many views also you can make lotus flowers.A well organised temple worth a visit.
great place brilliant for a day out. I liked all what I like may not suit you but you could like something I did not like so hard to say make your own mind up

Stunning. Amazing breathtaking temple, especially at night. Few things:- Steps are very steep so be careful, no high heels.-Ladies have to cover their shoulders and wear a skirt of trousers which are covering the knees. If you don't want to wear these type of clothes there are sarongs available at a price of 20 THB +100 THB deposit.-The entrance price is 50 THB.- At the moment there are quite few restoration works going on.- To get to the temple you need to cross the river by the boat which costs 3 THB.-The easiest way to get to the BTS station is to take a Chao Phraya Express Boat on the other side of the river (opposite Wat Arun) and ride to the Sathorn Pier. The ticket cost is 15 THB, it will also be like a mini tour around the river (saves you 900THB on touristy boats!)

a must to visit and do it late afternoon. u take a 3 baht ferry across tha tian ferry station to get to wat arun. make sure u plan visit late afternoon where it is cooler, less crowded. with the setting sun in the background, this wat looks incredibly beautiful and majestic. relax by the steps on yr climb up the wat. with the flowing river, wind and quietness during that time, one can enjoy the moment. by the time u leave the wat to take the ferry bacck across, the lights on the wat wld be on to give u a lighted, beautiful view of the wat.
Nice view. One of the must sees of BKK. Just across the river from Wat Pho. A boat will take you, and costs only 3 THB.

Wat Arun - worth the journey. The grounds are lovely, the temples adorned beautifully, and going to and from via the river is very relaxing. You need to take the express boat from Saphan Taskin (use the BTS)to pier 8 Tha Tien (40 TB) and then the cross river ferry will take you to Wat Arun (3 TB). Be sure to take some time for refreshments by the river and time this for sunset. The Grand Palace and Wat Pho are nearby so try to combine these landmarks. http://www.bangkok.com/attraction-waterway/chao-phraya-river-chao-phraya-river-pier-guide.htm
get boat here. go to grand palace then get a boat down the river for a couple of baht. boat will take you to the entrance. about 10 minute boat trip.
Too high ☝! !. If you are not afraid of heights then go for it, just bring your camera and monopod with you to capture the chow prhaya river along with other wat nearby.

Also good in day light. You can reach Wat Arun from Tha Thian pier which is between Reclining Buddha Temple and National Palace. You can climb one or two floors up two see the river and around. The details of the temple is amazing.
Awesome climb. It's easy to get there and only cost 50 baht to get in. The climb is awesomely steep and good adventure. Temple is just another typical one but glad we get to go up.

Night visit. We went of a night of which we knew it was closed but we could only fit it in then. Lit up at night it looks beautiful. Cant say much on dress code how much to get in etc so pritty mediocre review but we glad we still came to visit it. We got the riverboat at oriental for 15 baht pp then caught a river taxi to the opposite side at 3 baht pp. all pritty much sign posted. Grand palace is around here too so do both in one day if your able to.

You cannot skip it!. Try dedicating one day to visit all the temples since they are all close to each other, there also boat tours and walking tours. Its quite a scenery cause Wat Arun and Wat Pho or by the river.and watch out for the steps they are quite steep
Worth to visit. It is simply beautiful and it is easy to see after you have visited the Grand Palace and the reclining Buddha.

Easier to get to than you'd think. Wat Arun has a much calmer vibe than the main temples on the other side of the river. It's very easy to get to - public taxiboat for 3 baht (no need to negotiate with the longtail boats) and seems to run very frequently. The temple is currently undergoing restauration - a mammoth project given the size and amount of intricate pottery covering the facades. It's considerably less 'bling' than the other temples and i really liked that slightly more 'natural' look. The buddhas looked gently aged and authentic compared to the highly polished versions elsewhere. This was the only place i actually saw monks! There is also a meditation center which i think might be open to the public.There is a really nice café in the gardens which serves excellent iced tea/coffee/lemon&mint soda. This place is perfect if you want a break from the noise and touts of the other side of the river - if you have kids, this would be my first choice.Climb the stairs - they're not as bad as they look and view is spectacular.

Awesome Temple. This temple located near river and it's very awesome. The temple decoration was very detail. Please be aware the step if you want go to the top of temple. For now, some part of the temple still in renovation. Beside the temple, there are some store that sale souvenir and shirt and very recommended because it's cheap. i found that some item even cheaper than MBK. Definitely will come back again.
Beautiful Temple. A Beautiful Temple and well worth the visit and the steep climb to the top.It is a site not to be missed if you are visiting Bangkok.

One of the best temples in Thailand. A must visit temple, specially the view in the night. So beautiful to see the lighting. Night cruise gives you the mesmerizing charm. We went up with our toddler and enjoyed the view. The high you go the narrow the stairs but its a fun. Enjoyed the most, day or night!
Wat the temple. Wat Arun, Beautiful Temple by the river! Can't wait for my next visit!! Going early in the morning to avoid the crowd sure worth the trip~

Worth to visit. This temple is worth to visit. For ladies, please wear long pant or bring shawl to cover up. We reached the temple around 5pm and it is good time to take pictures or waiting for sunset. The steps are quite steep and coming down is not easy. The view up there is spectacular. Wat Arun has different view at night. It will light up and very beautiful.
Magnificent monument.. Be prepared to be overwhelmed with unbelievable beauty. Take time to look carefully. Ignore the large number of tourists.

Beware of scammers!. Beware of locals telling u it is closed for a few hrs for some rituals! They will suggest some places to go with tuk tuk (local mini taxi)! Never hop on! It's a scam! I remembered the one I met is a short guy around 165-170cm, can speak some English, has a little mustache, tanned, short hair, says that he is waiting for wife, even shows picture of his daughters on the phone, offers his map to us as well. The tuk tuk driver is taller around 175cm, fat, big earrings in the earlobe area, tanned and short hair. Too bad I didn't get the license number. Anyway be safe for all tourist!
A steep climb, but worth it !. My brother wanted to climb to the top for the views of the Royal Palace. He was not disappointed, but not for the faint hearted !.

A unic temple in a unic city. Bangkok is indeed a unic city - one you'll never see anywhere else. Wat Arun is deffinetly an unic temple which cannot be spotted anywhere too! it is fabolous at sunlight beautifully iluminated at night too. You can climb it up and it is steep but amazing. it is all covered in ceramics and creates a wonderfull piece of art!

Temple of Dawn. The Temple of Dawn is only a very short ferry ride across from the Grand Palace. Once again please dress appropriately for a Thai Temple. Once there I would recommend even the faint hearted to at least attempt the first level, to the temple area, as the stairs are very steep this is one Temple not for every one. Even if you cannot climb the stairs I feel you will still appreciate the Temple and grounds. For those who find they can traverse the first level you can then climb to the top level. You will not be disappointed by the view once you climb up though the climb down can be a worry for some I would still recommend the climb for those able to do it. The view and the height of the Temple complex is worth it.

YOU WILL LOVE IT. Ancient temple near the river, for climbing it up lot of effort as it has got very high steps nearly 18 to 25 inches high, takes out sweat like a water flow from your body. Best time to visit is during sunrise or sunset.
Vertigo!. History and adventure has its price. I almost have to call the firefigthers when I reach the top of this incredible relic.Make it a point to reach by vote.

Beautiful temple but be careful of the steps. We visted Wat Arun about 5 days ago and it is certainly worth seeing if you're in Bangkok. The temples decorations are very detailed and beautiful.You can climb up two flights of stairs on the main temple, the first set aren't too bad, but the second set are VERY steep, going up was fine but coming down was scary, particularly as people were pushing and shoving, it was quite dangerous. The view from the top is worth the climb though.There is a small fee of 50 Baht enter the temple and if you're a woman in shorts & singlet you will be given a sarong & scarf to wear.To have a good look around will only take you 30 - 60 minutes top.The best way to see the sights around the river in Bangkok is to take a boat, we were on a long tail boat tour, not really worth the money, I would have preferred to take the local boat but the others in our group wanted to do it this way.
Worth the boat ride. Very pretty place and the view from the other side of the river gives a nice perspective. Boat ride across is about .30 cents US.
Nice temple in Cambodian style. When we went, it was no too busy. Beautiful view when you climb up to the stupa. Lovely decorations on the walls.

A Good Place To Tour. I was across the river from this temple one night waiting for the river boat to arrive and noticed this place all lit up. It was a pretty spectacular site. I decided to come back the next day to see it. It was very interesting to tour but not for the faint of heart to see if you want to climb it. The stairs are extremely steep but worth the effort. The view from the top is great. I suspect it would be great to see after dark all lit up but have not done that. Maybe next trip I will give it a try at night.

Great experience. This was our first stop on our self lead tour of the temples in BKK. It was great to be able walk up the side of the main building and we got some great pictures from this view point. A good sense of history and the temples are well maintained. A must for culture lovers.

Must see. About 10 days ago we visited Wat Arun and we were at awe! The temple and all the structures have amazing details which are mostly covered in ceramic/porcelain tiles.Take the staris up to the second level of the temple to get some great photos or just views of the river. There is a small fee of 50 Baht enter the temple. Well worth the visit.

great view by sunset. If you managed to be there by sunset you will enjoy the views from up there, the stair are really steep it's a challenging climb!There is actually not to much activities to do there, Maximum visit time may range in 30 minutes give or take

An awe-inspiring temple!!!. To get to the Temple of Dawn/Wat Arun (Sounds like something from Indiana Jones..haha) take the Skytrain to Saphan Taksin (change at Siam) and walk down to the Central pier. From there, take a riverboat (not the tourist one) to Tha Tien Pier for about 15baht. (orange boats) - cheap right? :) Remember to bring sunnies and wear long pants/jeans. Ladies are to cover their shoulders too. There is a shawl station where you can cover yourself up if you are in "improper" attire. The steps to climb are pretty steep and you are well advised to wear comfortable shoes. Enjoy the bustle of the temple grounds and its a great photo opportunity! :D

IMPRESSIVE LOOKS OLDER THAN IT IS STEEP CLIMP. It's a very interesting old temple, and very impressive to look at. A very steep climb with extremely narrow steps. But everything in Bangkok looks older than it actually is. Maybe I'm bias and a bit "Templed Out" as I have visited them all many times by now. I just like Bangkok, and It's hustle & bustle....lol. If you have plenty of time and are into a less expensive look around, take the local ferry from Taksin Sapan BTS skyrain stop for 15 baht, get off at the appropriate pier, the ferry conductor staff will help you, (make sure you head up river), and use the cross river ferry for 8 baht. There is an entry fee, about 50 baht I think?? Saves 100's doint it this way.... and if you get caught by the touters with the long boat special tours, will save you 1000's. Near the Kings Palace, and other tourist attractions, so if you are short on time, maybe best to go for one of the all in tours that speak your language.
Beautiful place!. Beautiful place! It has so much details and great to admire. Beautiful place to walk, take picture and just relax.

Wat Arun. Best part about Wat arun is the stairs to go up..... My son enjoyed feeding bread to the fish and pigeons ate out of our hand. I was petrified to climb up the stair with my son as they are extremely steep. Climbing back down with a 2 1/2 year old was a killer. No guides. Poor safety standards for tourist. Thailand should learn more of english UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE.

Worth doing!. Wat Arun is a nice temple but is undergoing regular maintenance which can detract from the experience. Also be careful as it is hard to get to, with a lot of boat touts in the area meaning it is hard to get there for cheap. I'm sure it's doable, but I had to take a dangerous boat to get there as couldn't find the 'legitimate' route.The actual temple does have very steep stairs and they are hard to get down but don't let this put you off. You don't have to go up to the top. The actual temple was also a lot smaller in real life than I imagined it would be. It is near other major attractions like the reclining buddha and some markets so get all this into one day to make it worthwhile.

Looks Better Up Close. Walk up the steep staircases (and have fun getting back down). The view from the second level is quite good. If you like Temples, it's one to visit.To get there, use the bus stop type boat from the N Stops, and make your way to N8. Should only be about 15 Baht per person. Then use the jetty alongside to get onto a ferry to hop to the other riverbank. This is only 3 Baht at the ticket turn style. At the other side, it's only a few hundred feet to walk to the entrance.There is a small cafe just before the entrance for drinks and icecream which is very handy on a hot day (today was 35 degrees).Make sure you are wearing respectable clothing, covering at least the knees and shoulders as with most Temples in Thailand.I hope this review helps you.

Beautiful place with such detail. It's a beautiful temple with many details in the construction.You need to wear propper clothes when you go there, but can borrow cover up pieces if you're wearing shorts or a tanktop.It's a steep climb up the stairs to get to the top. Wear flats :)

A must see in Bangkok. This place is amazing, but be careful with the stairs! Feel free to spend time exploring all different sides of the temple, go to the top and enjoy the view! You'll not regret it :)
great take. Take the ferry across the river for like 3 baht and it lands you right at the temple. Good climb up, and really nice ground surrounding. Great for pictures.

Best one in Bangkok. Amazing experience to climb to the top - very steep stairs! There was a great view of the city and if it is quiet you can hear the bells ringing from the very top. I highly recommend it.

That's one steep climb!. From anywhere along several kilometers of the Chao Phraya river, the towering Wat Arun dominates the landscape, especially when lit up at night. Up close, you'll risk a sore neck from continually looking UP! The stairway up the face of the temple is most definitely not for the faint of heart, either.Upon close inspection, I was amazed to discover that the entire temple is inlaid with broken dishes. Yes, bits and pieces of plates and saucers of every description. Looking UP from anywhere around the base, you will see a million shattered plates stacked into the sky!Though it is mind bogglingly 'busy' when observed up close, Wat Arun is best viewed from a distance.
intricate workmanship. There are no words that would adequately describe the Temple of Dawn. It is a "must see" in Bangkok.
A Must See. Great temple and nice little ride over the river - set in a sweet little park area - definitely worth an hour

"Wat"ed Out. So you are in hot sticky noisy chaotic Bangkok, did I mention hot? A nice getaway is to the Temple of Dawn, however in Thailand one tends to not only get rather weary of rice rice rice rice but also of Wats. This Wat is nice in location as it takes you on the Chao Prahya river where cooler breezes blow (we hope and pray). The structure is much more beautiful from afar and with setting sun (or rising) a good photo op awaits the avid photo bugs reading this. But the closer you get to the building it is rather tired looking and not loved with mosaic pieces broken away and signs that "WOMAN CANNOT ENTER" for let us remember, we females with our menstrual cycles are a filthy bunch - try telling a monk that the reason he is on this earth is because of menstrual cycles. Still if you are new to BKK it is a must see, much like any iconic building/statue/cathedral/wat. Use a UV umbrella while in Thailand, it will keep you cooler.

High climb for river view. Wat Arun is one of those must see temples in Bangkok. It is easy to get there by ferry or long tail boat from the pier near the Grand Palace. Expect to be making a long and hard climb to the top of the Stupa if you want to see much, but it is worth the effort. The way is very old and built in a style quit different from the ones on the other side of the river. I also enjoy the food stands on the grounds. We always take our visitors there and they seem to enjoy both the ride there and the Wat.

Favorite temple so far. Yes there are so many temples in Thailand, but this one is my favorite in Bangkok. If you go to Ko Rattanakosin area in the morning you can visit Grand Palace, Wat Po and Wat Arun in one day. Keep Wat Arun for the last as you may want to take pictures when it is lit after dark.My first visit to Wat Arun was in the evening, 30 minutes before closing time (it closes at 18.00) so we got in for free. The details of the temple is so unique. They use broken porcelain plates, bowls and cups to decorate the whole temple.My second visit was on Loy Krathong night. There were fireworks, floating candles and a lot of people float their krathongs on the river. Stunningly beautiful!

Wonderful! . We went so see Wat Arun around 17.00, which meant the light was beautiful! We saw the sunset from the top and took some great picture of everything in that golden glow. Definitely worth a visit! Tips: the stairs are steep, so if you're scared of heights, this might be tricky. Also: women have to cover legs and shoulders! Don't wear shorts or they will make you rent a sarong to wrap around you, which makes climbing steep stairs worse!
Beautiful Temple. You need to take a boat and cross the river to go to Wat Arun. Absolutely beautiful. The steps to go up are pretty steep so be careful especially while getting down.
Wat Arun. A very good temple across the river. Do climb the stairs to see the upper portion of the temple. Looks best when lights are on. Good photo oppurtunites in and around temple.

A must see!. Just like a number of other sights in Bangkok, and temples, the visit would not be the same without seeing this marvel! Exceptional structure and craftsmanship. Its easy access to the temple with the cross-river shuttle boat and especially stunning at night. Don't miss it!

Beyond belief. By night, the view of the temple is extraordinary; by day the view from the temple gives you a perspective of the growth of the City of Angels - beautiful! Make sure to maintain your cultural focus - temples are the holiest of places.

Worth it. Probably the best river view we had in Bangkok since you can see the palace on the other side of the river from the top of the temple. An interesting temple to explore and a nice garden to walk around in. It is definitely worth visiting.

Great place offering great view of Chao Phraya Revier and nearby surroundings. Brilliant place; very well maintained. The temple offered great views of the surrounding areas particularly CHao Phraya River. However, it as steep clim ; not meant for the aged and small children
Must see. Great spot. You should do a longtail boat tour before. They usually end at Wat Arun. Then climb the temple and enjoy thre spectacular view over Bangkok.
Unbelievable. Such and amazing buildings, You can see them and still don't believe it, pay attention to the little soldiers placed within the walls, they are very detailed.

Incredible view. Initially I was reluctant to go on this, and then I did. You have to climb to the top of the Temple to discover its magic. One can see a lot of bangkok from here, along with beautiful carvings and idols. Recommended.

Beautiful temple. Fantastic especially looks great in the night from the Chao Phraya river.
Went on Chao Phraya Princess river cruise, enjoyed the night dinner and travelling along the river. The temple is stunning and beautiful.

Excellent. A day well spent at the temple pf Dawn. Truely amazing place. We took a night dinner cruise a night before and we saw this beautiful temple. I told my husband that we had to visit it the next day. Then on the next day we were there. Took the tuktuk from our hotel which was about 20 minutes drive from this temple. There were so many tourists but yet so peaceful. Luckily it was quite cloudy but we were lucky it didn't rain. We spent about 2 hours walking around and sitting inside the temple campus.
Hop on the ferry. A very quick ferry trip from the pier near wat poh, worth doing. You can climb partially up wat Arun but it is quite steep but great photo opportunities
A "must do" in Bangkok.. Would recommend a guided tour to make the most of this place. Tour takes about 30 min and the food market is also interesting to try.

An Iconic Temple for Bangkok. This is one of the most iconic temples in Bangkok and nestled on the riverbank of Chao Phraya river. However, nothing much to do here. If you like taking photos, it's better to go here around sunset to night fall, as the colors of the lights are more appealing and the temperature would be a bit cooler than during the day.
A must see in Bangkok. The view of the city, the river and the history of the site is amazing. You should wear appropriate shoes if you want to climb to the top.

easy trip across the river. Explore the thonburi neighborhood near the temple. Theres a nice walk along the water and lots of little alleys and cats. Temple itself is beautiful. Very cheap ferry ride across.

Although small, unique and beautiful.. The whole place is only an hour tour at the most but a very unique and beautiful place with great view of the river from the top.you can cross the river from it to the other side (or to it), in about 5 baht a person.

The most famous Temple... Wat Arun or The Temple of Dawn is among the ancient temples of Thailand which have their own history. Just think how it was built and one must appreciate the builders whomever took part..if you are on a boat you would see it from a distance. and you can't simply turn your eyes off unless it disappears as you cruise further. This temple looks very beautiful under the lights..So must come here if you are in Bangkok..or in Krung thep mahanakhon Amon rathanakosin ayyothiya mahadillok Phonnoprath ratachtaniburi..... it goes on.. ( This is the name of Bangkok in Thai language...

Absolutely beautiful !. Going there is a bit tricky, especially for tourists, so you might need to properly check the boat ride fees to get there since some may offer you a higher price than what it really costs. During the time that I went there, some parts are still under construction or renovation, nevertheless, it should not stop you from going there because it is still beautiful. A bit scary when you try to climb to the top as it is steep. You should also take a chance of getting a picture, wearing the traditional costumes with a cheap price to pay !

Unique. Part of the fun of visiting this temple is taking a trip on a longtail in the canals! The temple itself is beautiful. I had seen this temple many times in photos, but to see it in reality was wonderful - the way the temple was constructed, with mortar and porcelain: just amazing!

best site in bangkok!. We done a lot of sightseeing while in the city and this was by far our favorite place. Cracking view, beautiful temple. A must see while in Bangkok. Dont listen to this guy ¬ lol

Breath of Ancietry. When u look at Wat Arun from the opposite side of the river, u feel it pulls you. u can't wait the boat to bring u there. U want to touch it and breathe the air near this temple asap. When u are there - u are staying in astonishment to this magnificent, wonderful architectural monument. Lot's of tiny statues, details cut off from stone make u forget u are in 21st century and return you back to old times. I really liked the place. If i had more time - i would sit there for several hours meditating

great views. It was interesting to visit an older temple, we got there by a boat tour which was a bit of a rip off but the temple itself was great. After a steep climb to the top the architechture and views were amazing, especially if you go on a clear day. Be sure to dress appropriatly in long pants or skirt and cover your shoulders or you will be asked to rent clothes from them.

Famous and beautiful. Wat Arun is one of the famous and most visited temples in Bangkok and its is remarkable with its location and architecture. If you are brave enough then you could probably climb to the top but it is definitely not a beautiful task. The place can be a bit crowded and the traffic around the city is a bit chaotic. Try taking the trip with a sunset or sunrise for the view is best at these times.

Georgous Architecture!. This building is as unique as it can be in Bangkok. While most temples pretty resemble one another, Wat Arun as a special flair about it. It sticks out in the middle of the city and can be access through either boat or road. A definitely must do while in Bangkok either early in the morning or late evening while it is all lit up!

OK for one time watch. Went to this temple during evening time. Architecture was good but nothing of Wow type. Though coming from river it will give a good sight.Just opposite you have Wah Pho and Grand place which are must visit. They are pretty huge temples with lot of art.

The Best of Many Temples. The one temple I'd suggest as a 'must see.' Sure, the reclining buddha is cool, but this is the most beautiful of the MANY temples we saw--at least on the exterior. Not for those that are hesitant with heights because the steps are steeper than many ladders.

Beautiful place. I love this place. Great at sunset for some photos, and when it is quieter. When heading to get the boat here, ignore all of the hawkers trying to sell you boat trips. Walk through the market until you get to a turnstile. I think it was 3 or 5 baht each to cross the river. They have a couple of shops in the grounds too which were lovely to sit and cool off in the shade with an iced coffee.

Architecturally wonderful. Architecturally wonderful. Did attempt to climb the steep stem but returned half way. Nice scenery around and nice boat trip from across the river. Could provide some more shades for people a s it gets quite hot in the afternoons. Still a place to visit. Missed visiting it in the night.

The beauty of the old world. I was on a company trip and was sort of following my colleagues around Bangkok for most of the trip. So on the last day, I decided I had to at least see one of the temples that are always so talked about by my friend and since Wat Arun as recommended by a friend by name I decided to go there and I was not at all disappointed.There is such a sense of serenity as you walk around the compound and temple even tho there was quite a few groups of people visiting. I took my time and walked around the place slowly while looking at the carvings on the walls. While yes, it was run down and did need restoration, I could imagine what it looked like centuries ago. A word of caution tho, climbing up to the top does take a bit of courage as the incline is extremely steep, it was more a ladder than stairs I felt. but the view once you reached the top was amazing. I am so glad I didn't miss a trip here
such a romantic place. As its name, you should visit the temple by dawn and enjoy the magical view of its golden roof. Climb to the top of the temple and enjoy the beautiful view of Chao Praya river

Beautiful for watching a Bangkok sunset. A must location to climb and watch the sunset! The admission fee is cheap, and be prepared for an exciting climb up the steep facade of the Wat as you navigate 2 lader-stairs made of stone.
Glittering gem. Visit at sunset. The temple looks stunning in night lights!Be careful while climbing to top. Its a steep climb!

Wat Arun - need better guides to fully appreciate the value of such sites. Wat Arun has been rated as a must see temple in Bangkok. So we went with a fair amount of expectation that was not met! The temple's sculptures are beautiful and intricate but the steep climb up the temple is a bit of a bother. Theview of the river from even the first floor is good enough. Also we were so disappointed with our guide at Wat Pho that we didnot hire one here. I think that also made our experience incomplete.what was really impressive was the hall ( from outside) with the two huge colourful guards standing outside and beautiful gardens surrounding it.never seen so many bonsais in my life!

Beautiful but need more restoration. One more beautiful temple around Bangkok, different since you can go up stairs near the top (be prepared because the stairs are not easy). It is beautiful during the day and at night with the lights on. Go up and take good photos from the river. It's now being restored but still have a loot of work to do to have this place as it deserves.
Marvelous Construction. Likes: beautifully-built, overwhelming sunset, typical Thai constructionDislikes: steep stairs, too many tourists

Beautiful. This is a beautiful place to see. There are a lot of steep stairs if you want to ascend the temple. Also you have to remove your shoes to go inside the temple. The night view from the river is even more spectacular than the up close view.
Beautiful view from across the river. Great place to test you fear of heights! It's a must when the weather is great to come to this place during sunset.

Still beautiful in the evening light. Nice position on bord of the Chao Phrayo River. Impressing building with lot of nice details. It's possible to climb up almost to the top of the Chedi. Great view to the Wat Phra Kaeo (Kings Palace) and life on the river. Surrounding of the Temple is well-kepted. A few market stands selling souvenirs, some food and other little things.

A nice temple.. We visited this temple as a part of our Bangkok day tour. It was very beautifully designed with the detailed carvings. We had coconut water outside the temple. To climb to the top the flight is very steep so one must be careful. But definitely worth the view and also calls for good photo ops.

Very good attraction - part of river trip. We took a 1.5 hour river trip in a long-tailed boat along the river; this was the stop on the journey.There is a 50 Baht entrance fee (£1) per person, but the views are worth it.You can climb up the outside of the temple for better views, but the steps are so steep they are more like ladders than steps.

Historic temple to visit. Take a boat to cross the Chao Phraya river, this is one of Bangkok’s best know n landmark. There are many tourists there, it's beautiful that you can see both side of the river. Carefully climb up the steep stairs to see for a decent view.

Chose Wat Arun over Wat Pho if given. - Best time to visit is twilight. Go there around 5pm, climb up the temple so you may experience the sun set and capture the beautiful temple in lights. - yes climbing up is a bit typical as stairs are steep. You need to be a bit careful. Its definitely not scary or sth to be afraid of! - From Wat Pho you can go to Wat Arun for 3 Baht by a Ferry. The entrance at Wat Arun is 50 baht (for Wat Pho it is 100 baht)
Worth for visit. It is located on Bank of Chophrya River or RIVER KING. There are many tourists there, it's so beautiful that you can see both side of the river. Highly recommended!

Ripoff Tour. Be careful not to fall for the tour selling at around 2500 baht per person which includes a 20min stop at Wat Arun. When you stop at the temple you need to pay a fee to land at the jetty and then you still need to buy a ticket to get into the tempe and 20mins isn't close to enough time even to see 20% of the site. The trip through the old canals is pretty cool so I would recommend splitting the trip in 2 and also rather go to the main pier and rent a boat direct from a local and not from the tour guides.

Approach from the river.. Plenty of ferries and private boats from adjacent to the Shangri la hotel and under the Sky Train. It becomes very crowded at the temple but fun to see and to climb up for a decent view.

Beautiful monument. Brilliant, climbing stairs and view from top was just excellent. the river view from top is brilliant. dont remember the entry fee but it was nominal. got chance to take fotograph in thai traditional dress for 75baht, which was great.
very nice. The amazing place to visit.The view from the temple to the river and the city is amazing.Must visit place.

A steep climb but a great time!. This is a lovely temple with incredible views. I took a ferry ride over and then climbed to the top with my friends. It isn't 5 star simply because it's a quick and simple experience, but it's a very famous and beautiful temple, and it was great to get a quick visit.
